quote: Jesus tells us: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself’ (Mk 12:31). How can we love our neighbor if we can’t or won’t love ourselves, at least a little? When we hold ourselves to unrealistic standards, that perfectionist attitude can’t help but trickle down. It becomes harder to have compassion for others if we have no compassion for ourselves.
author: Mary DeTurris Poust, Cravings: A Catholic Wrestles with Food, Self-Image, and God

quote: The authentic human has the might of compassion and the creative power to do any manner of good.
author: Bryant McGill, Voice of Reason
category: attitudes, compassion, creative, individuality, power, uniqueness

quote: Once we are able to combine a feeling of empathy for others with a profound understanding of the suffering they experience, we become able to generate genuine compassion for them. We must work at this continually.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: One-time rival and subsequent usurper Secretary of State Seward finally settled into an assessment of Lincoln that, "His confidence and compassion increase every day.
author: Doris Kearns Goodwin, Team of Rivals: The Political Genius of Abraham Lincoln

quote: Spread your happiness to others and let them spread theirs to you.
author: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Compassion is not a virtue -- it is a commitment. It's not something we have or don't have -- it's something we choose to practice.
author: Brené Brown, I Thought It Was Just Me: Women Reclaiming Power and Courage in a Culture of Shame

quote: My mother said I must always be intolerant of ignorance but understanding of illiteracy. That some people, unable to go to school, were more intelligent and more educated than college professors.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Ecclesiastes names thee Almighty, the Maccabees name thee Creator, the Epistle to the Ephesians names thee Liberty, Baruch names thee Immensity, the Psalms name thee Wisdom and Truth, John names thee Light, the Book of Kings names thee Lord, Exodus names thee Providence, Leviticus Sanctity, Esdras Justice, creation names thee God, man names thee Father; but Solomon names thee Compassion, which is the most beautiful of all thy names.
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

quote: It is not what you leave to your children that matters, but what you leave in them.
author: Shannon L. Alder, 300 Questions to Ask Your Parents Before It's Too Late
category: activist, charity, children, compassion, humanity, parenting, service

quote: Those who say life is knocking them down and giving them a tough time are usually the first to beat themselves up. Be on your own side.
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru
category: compassion, fighting, inspiring-quotes, kindness, life, life-lessons, peace-of-mind, rasheed-ogunlaru, rasheed-ogunlaru-quotes, self-sabotage

quote: Tolstoy said, 'The antagonism between life and conscience may be removed either by a change of life or by a change of conscience.' Many of us have elected to adjust our consciences rather than our lives. Our powers of rationalization are unlimited. They allow us to live in luxury and indifference while others, whom we could help if we chose to, starve and go to hell.
author: Randy Alcorn, Money, Possessions and Eternity
category: caring, change, compassion, conscience, conviction, guilt, hell, hunger, indifference, power, rationalization, starvation, stewardship, tolstoy

quote: Familiarity is the gateway drug to empathy.
author: iO Tillett Wright

quote: God's people are not to accumulate stuff for tomorrow but to share indiscriminately with the scandalous and holy confidence that God will provide for tomorrow. Then we need not stockpile stuff in barns or a 401(k), especially when there is someone in need.
author: Shane Claiborne, Red Letter Revolution: What If Jesus Really Meant What He Said?
category: accumulation, christianity, community, compassion, giving, hoarding, lack, need, poverty, profits, provision, redistribution, save, savings, sharing, wealth

quote: We become neighbors when we are willing to cross the road for one another. (...) There is a lot of road crossing to do. We are all very busy in our own circles. We have our own people to go to and our own affairs to take care of. But if we could cross the road once in a while and pay attention to what is happening on the other side, we might indeed become neighbors.
author: Henri J.M. Nouwen, Bread for the Journey: A Daybook of Wisdom and Faith
category: attention, busy, compassion, love, love-your-neighbor, neighbors

quote: Imagine you saw a colour in your dream, which you have never seen before. It doesn't consist of any colours or shades that you know. Trying to describe that colour would be as difficult as trying to belive that there is enough love & compassion in the world so every human can feel happiness.
author: Egor Kraft

quote: Pity. What a useless emotion when you don't act on it. Pity is supposed to trigger compassion.
author: Lish McBride, Heads Will Roll

quote: ...writers, like priests, should have compassion...and a sensitivity to pain...
author: John Geddes, A Familiar Rain

quote: Life has two choices: create or destruct. These choices are the backbone for all, within oneself and outside oneself. Too many ways of thinking are described by too many people that have no idea. If you're attached to your ways then detach, so you can change. Use this detachment in your writing, relationships, and understanding of life. Our future as individuals, as nations, and as mankind can only go one way. It's our choice whether we want the painful path or the peaceful path.
author: Mark  Donnelly, Silent Prophet
category: compassion, counteracting-pain, hope, living-in-creativity, love, peace, truth

quote: If they had had a different neighbour, one less sel-absorbed and more concerned for others, a man of normal, charitable instincts, their desperate state would not have gone unnoticed, their distress-signals would have been heard, and perhaps they would have been rescued by now. Certainly they appeared utterly depraved, corrupt, vile and odious; but it is rare for those who have sunk so low not to be degraded in the process, and there comes a point, moreover, where the unfortunate and the infamous are grouped together, merged in a single, fateful world. They are les misérables - the outcasts, the underdogs. And who is to blame? Is it not the most fallen who have most need for charity?
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

quote: No tear, is a wasted tear, if it spills out for love, whether in good times or bad.
author: Anthony Liccione

quote: There are men who dig for gold
author: [Monseigneur Bienvenu] dug for compassion.

quote: Mindful of not thanking their benefactors, in case, like wights, they took offense, she added, "Your kindness is gratefully acknowledged. May your trees be forever fruitful.
author: Cecilia Dart-Thornton, The Battle of Evernight
category: compassion, courtesy, faeries, fairies, kindness, thank-you

quote: She had seen what it cost him and her heart quickened with compassion. For that alone, she might have loved him almost.
author: Cecilia Dart-Thornton, The Battle of Evernight

quote: We can all benefit by learning to express and meet out physical needs in a loving, caressing and compassionate way
author: David Bresler

quote: Tread softly because you tread on my dreams
author: W.B. Yeats

quote: Since my arrival in Rome, I have had many opportunities to wonder if compassion’s opposite is cruelty, or to reflect whether or not indifference would serve as a better black to its white.
author: Andrew Levkoff, A Mixture of Madness

quote: I was grateful to Ben the way you are grateful to someone who is unexpectedly kind.
author: Cheryl Drake Harris, Lily's Ghost

quote: True kindness ennobles the giver
author: Jocelyn  Murray

quote: SANSHO THE BAILIFF (1954) 'Without compassion a man is no longer human.' So states Taira.
author: Steven Jay Schneider, 1001 Movies You Must See Before You Die

quote: LOVE is measured in GAUGE TWENTY- specifically, love pressure in the surrounding area. If it drops below four percent, though, you may have trouble-the VW might get sad, slow down, or even stop altogether. If this occurs, you have to immediately find/write a story that somehow convinces him that there is more love, caring or compassion in the area than he thinks there is. I can’t tell you how many times this has been a problem for us- how many trips were interrupted because I had to head into the nearest populated town to see if we could find examples of kindness.
author: Christopher Boucher, How to Keep Your Volkswagen Alive: A Novel

quote: Why are...poor people more ready to share their goods than rich people? The answer is easy: The poor have little to lose; the rich have more to lose and they are more attached to their possessions. Poverty provides a deeper motivation for understanding your neighbors, welcoming others and attending to those who are suffering. I would go so far as to say that poverty helps you understand what happiness is, what serenity is in life.
author: Piero Gheddo
category: attachment, attention, christianity, compassion, empathy, giving, happiness, motivation, neighbor, poor, possessions, poverty, rich, selfishness, serenity, sharing, suffering, understanding, wealth, welcoming

quote: Compassion constitutes a radical form of criticism, for it announces that the hurt is to be taken seriously, that the hurt is not to be accepted as normal and natural but is an abnormal and unacceptable condition for humanness.
author: Walter Brueggemann

quote: Love is my decision to make your problem my problem.
author: Robert A. Schuller

quote: Her own misery filled her heart—there was no room in it for other people's sorrow.
author: George Eliot, Adam Bede

quote: God is not glorified when we keep for ourselves (no matter how thankfully) what we ought to be using to alleviate the misery of unevangelized, uneducated, unmedicated, and unfed millions. The evidence that many professing Christians have been deceived by this doctrine is how little they give and how much they own. God has prospered them. And by an almost irresistible law of consumer culture (baptized by a doctrine of health, wealth, and prosperity) they have bought bigger (and more) houses, newer (and more) cars, fancier (and more) clothes, better (and more) meat, and all manner of trinkets and gadgets and containers and devices and equipment to make life more fun. They will object: Does not the Old Testament promise that God will prosper his people? Indeed! God increases our yield, so that by giving we can prove our yield is not our god. God does not prosper a man's business so that he can move from a Ford to a Cadillac. God prospers a business so that 17,000 unreached people can be reached with the gospel. He prospers the business so that 12 percent of the world's population can move a step back from the precipice of starvation.
author: John Piper, Desiring God: Meditations of a Christian Hedonist
category: caring, compassion, evangelism, giving, gospel, greed, hunger, need, prosperity, sharing, starvation, stewardship

quote: Awakening self-compassion is often the greatest challenge people face on the spiritual path.
author: Tara Brach, True Refuge: Finding Peace and Freedom in Your Own Awakened Heart

quote: The bread which you hold back belongs to the hungry; the coat, which you guard in your locked storage-chests, belongs to the naked; the footwear mouldering in your closet belongs to those without shoes. The silver that you keep hidden in a safe place belongs to the one in need. Thus, however many are those whom you could have provided for, so many are those whom you wrong.
author: Basil the Great
category: compassion, hunger, naked, poor, poverty, sharing, stealing, stewardship, wealth

quote: Bragging about your compassion is the first step towards feeling a genuine emotion.
author: Bauvard, Some Inspiration for the Overenthusiastic

quote: They looked at me, and were so full of delight in the pleasure they were giving me that some final thread of resistance gave way and I understood not only how entirely generous they were but also that generosity might be the greatest pleasure there is.
author: William Maxwell, So Long, See You Tomorrow

quote: It is always so, when we are unhappy we feel more strongly the unhappiness of others; our feeling is not shattered, but becomes concentrated...
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: If people can live through genocide and retain compassion, if they can take strength in pain, if they are able, still, to laugh, then certainly we can learn something from them.
author: Eric Greitens, The Heart and the Fist: The Education of a Humanitarian, the Making of a Navy SEAL

quote: I always try to share with others the idea that in order to become compassionate it is not necessary to become religious.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: A visitor asked Lincoln what good news he could take home from an audience with the august executive. The president spun a story about a machine that baffled a chess champion by beating him thrice. The stunned champ cried while inspecting the machine, "There's a man in there!"Lincoln's good news, he confided from the heights of leadership, was that there was in fact a man in there.
author: Shelby Foote, The Civil War, Vol. 1: Fort Sumter to Perryville

quote: There is a kind of virtue that lies not in extraordinary actions, not in saving poor orphans from burning buildings, but in steadfastly working for a world where orphans are not poor and buildings comply with decent fire codes.
author: Randy Cohen

quote: This is the shade of difference: the door of the physician should never be shut, the door of the priest should always be open.
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

quote: The news can be poison to your soul, don't let it kill your joy, be compassionate but not consumed. Be empathetic not enraged.
author: Rob Liano

quote: Compassion is born from the imagination. To have the desire to be compassionate, you have to imagine a world that’s better than the one you live in.
author: Ryan Henry Ward Artist

quote: The problem with churches of all sorts,” he continued, “is that so often they ignore the key teachings of the Sermon on the Mount, like the doctrine of love. So often we ask God to be on our side instead of asking that we be blessed enough to be on his. That said, the wheat and the tares must grow up together, and in the days of harvest they will be separated properly.
author: David  Holdsworth, Angelos
category: churches, compassion, doctrine, god-s-love, harvest, joy, justice, love, mount, peace, sermon, society-humanity, tares, together, wheat

quote: Oh, Hank," Susan whispered, "their wings are furry.""Oh, James," Harriet whispered, "their hands are kind.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin, Catwings
category: cats, compassion, fantasy, friendship, kids, wonder

quote: (...) I let go, crying and unable to stop because God was such a dirty crook, contemptible skunk, that's what he was for doing that thing to that woman. Come down out of the skies, you God, come on down and I'll hammer your face all over the city of Los Angeles, you miserable unpardonable prankster. If it wasn't for you, this woman would not have been so maimed, and neither would the world, (...)
author: John Fante, Ask the Dust

quote: If you see your brother in need, it doesn't matter if you already gave somewhere else. You should be open to the idea of God using you to meet your brother's unexpected need.
author: Andy Stanley, Fields Of Gold
category: brother, burden, caring, christianity, compassion, giving, need, sharing, stewardship

quote: You can not hope to arrive at harmony in your life while stirring up disturbances in anothers...
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru
category: compassion, consciousness, harmony, mindfulness, oneness, peace, understanding

quote: Now there are many, many people in the world, but relatively few with whom we interact, and even fewer who cause us problems. So when you come across such a chance for practicing patience and tolerance, you should treat it with gratitude. It is rare. Just as having unexpectedly found a treasure in your own house, you should be happy and grateful toward your enemy for providing you that precious opportunity. Because if you are ever to be successful in your practice of patience and tolerance, which are critical factors in counteracting negative emotions, it is due to your own efforts and also the opportunity provided by your enemy.
author: Dalai Lama XIV
category: compassion, compassion-wisdom, enemy, inspirational, interaction, kindness, patience, peace, wisdom

quote: We're merely one tree with various types, shapes and sizes of leaves that all wave differently in the breeze
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru
category: awareness, co-operation, compassion, illumination, inspiring-quotes, kindness, liberation, mindfulness, quotes-about-life, rasheed-ogunlaru, thoughtfulness, trees, understanding-oneself-and-others

quote: To me, empathy and compassion are among the bravest of emotions ... and faith, the bravest of convictions.
author: Gerard de Marigny, Rise to the Call
category: compassion, courage, empathy, faith, heroes, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, inspirational-religious

quote: There are ultimately two choices in life: to fight it or to embrace it. If you fight it you will lose - if you embrace it you become one with it and you'll be lived.
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru
category: compassion, embracing-life, energy, flow, happiness, inspirational-quotes, life-changing, life-choices, mindfulness, peace, peace-of-mind, rasheed-ogunlaru, understanding, wisdom

quote: Am I ever angry or frustrated? I only feel angry sometimes when I see waste, when things that we waste are what people need, things that would save them from dying. Frustrated? No, never.
author: Mother Teresa, The Joy in Loving: A Guide to Daily Living
category: anger, angry, compassion, dying, frustrated, frustration, need, poverty, sharing, waste

quote: Tomorrow's leaders will not lead dictating from the front, nor pushing from the back. They will lead from the centre - from the heart
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru, Soul Trader: Putting the Heart Back into Your Business
category: compassion, empowering-others, evolved-consciousness, leaders, leadership, leadership-styles, liberation, management-styles, oneness, peace, rasheed-ogunlaru, understanding

quote: Need' now means wanting someone else's money. 'Greed' means wanting to keep your own. 'Compassion' is when a politician arranges the transfer.
author: Joseph Sobran

quote: Among other things, neuroplasticity means that emotions such as happiness and compassion can be cultivated in much the same way that a person can learn through repetition to play golf and basketball or master a musical instrument, and that such practice changes the activity and physical aspects of specific brain areas.
author: Andrew Weil, Spontaneous Healing

quote: The universe is not for man alone, but is a theater of evolution for all living beings. Live and let live is its guiding principle. 'Ahimsa Paramo Dharmah' - Non-injury is the highest religion.
author: Virchand Gandhi
category: ahimsa, compassion, evolution, inspirational, jainism, live, living-life, motivational, nonviolence, nonviolence-jainism, peace, religion, universe

quote: You ought not to love the individuals of your domestic circle less, but to love those who exist beyond it more. Once make the feelings of confidence and of affection universal, and the distinctions of property and power will vanish; nor are they to be abolished without substituting something equivalent in mischief to them, until all mankind shall acknowledge an entire community of rights.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley, The Necessity of Atheism and Other Essays

quote: I can’t hope to convey the full effect of the embraces and avowals, but I can perhaps offer a crumb of counsel. If there is anybody known to you who might benefit from a letter or a visit, do not on any account postpone the writing or the making of it. The difference made will almost certainly be more than you have calculated
author: Christopher Hitchens
category: compassion, death, friendship, illness, love, solidarity, sympathy

quote: Love is the only answer to every question
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru

quote: It made Daniel think. The people who had the least were the most willing to share. He outlined a dictum that he would believe the rest of his life: the more people have, the less the give. Similarly, generous cultures produce less waste because excess is shared, whereas stingy nations fill their landfills with leftovers.
author: Mark Sundeen, The Man Who Quit Money

quote: The master demon Screwtape identifies elitist humanity's tendency toward "an ingrained habit of belittling anything that concerns the great mass of their fellow men.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters: Also Includes "Screwtape Proposes a Toast"

quote: Since the state must necessarily provide subsistence for the criminal poor while undergoing punishment, not to do the same for the poor who have not offended is to give a premium on crime.
author: John Stuart Mill, Principles of Political Economy

quote: Who are we to make such a decision? To allow another living being - any living being - to die, when ours is the power to prevent it? - Reed Richards (Mister Fantastic)
author: John Byrne, The Fantastic Four: The Trial of Galactus

quote: Dare we care at all about current fashions if that means reducing our ability to help hungry neighbors? How many more luxuries should we buy for ourselves and our children when others are dying for lack of bread?
author: Ronald J. Sider, Rich Christians in an Age of Hunger: Moving from Affluence to Generosity
category: christian, christianity, compassion, fashion, hunger, luxury, necessity, neighbors, obedience, poverty, rich, style, wealth

quote: Lately it's started to seem to me that here in America our fetishization of self-reliance has taken a wrong turn and has helped enable us to jettison compassion as a national value while still maintaining a vision of ourselves as essentially well-meaning. It hasn't taken a whole lot of common sense, given the evidence of the last few years, to puzzle out the heartlessness of unregulated capitalism, and yet our political class has embraced even more fervently the notion of every man for himself, even given the ever-growing numbers such a philosophy leaves behind.
author: Jim Shepard

quote: John has a narrow mind. For him, neither the beauty nor the prosperity of the city of Ephesus is worth a second glance. Ephesus was situated at the end of the Silk Road from China and the caravan route from India which used to pass through the Parthian Empire en route to the West. But the prophet is quite unaware that this particular world exists at all. Even culture means absolutely nothing to him; for example, in 18:22 he rejoices that not only song but also the sound of the flute have disappeared. The world which he knows is limited to the seven churches whose Christianity corresponded with his own; and that in but a single province of the Roman Empire, namely Asia. As to the rest, he is only familiar with the mother church in Jerusalem and the sister church in Rome.John is utterly obsessed by Rome. The fact that this particular metropolis had bestowed both law and peace upon no less than one-half of the world never got through to him at all. He is also quite oblivious of the fact that Rome oppresses nations and exploits slaves. He could not care less about national or social considerations. He abominates the "whore on the seven hills" simply because Rome is persecuting Christians. This is precisely what the Apocalypse is all about: innocent suffering.
author: Gilles Quispel, The Secret Book of Revelation: The Apocalypse of St John the Divine
category: apocalypse, compassion, culture, ignorance, obsession, suffering

quote: While there is Ego, you will never be one with the universe... Or love your fellow man.
author: Solange nicole

quote: Really good writing has purpose and that purpose should be to shape other minds to desire truth and a more noble purpose in life and to become more thoughtful and knowledgable about important things like being kind and loving towards all living beings on our planet and not just humans but all animals.
author: Susan Waterfield
category: compassion, existence, meaning, purpose, seeking-truth, writing

quote: No daylight to separate us.Only kinship. Inching ourselves closer to creating a community of kinship such that God might recognize it. Soon we imagine, with God, this circle of compassion. Then we imagine no one standing outside of that circle, moving ourselves closer to the margins so that the margins themselves will be erased. We stand there with those whose dignity has been denied. We locate ourselves with the poor and the powerless and the voiceless. At the edges, we join the easily despised and the readily left out. We stand with the demonized so that the demonizing will stop. We situate ourselves right next to the disposable so that the day will come when we stop throwing people away.
author: Gregory J. Boyle, Tattoos on the Heart: The Power of Boundless Compassion
category: christian, compassion, god, kinship, margins, solidarity

quote: There are those who do not hold that there is any innate goodness to mankind. To them I say, had you lived my life, you would not believe it. I have known the depths to which mortals are capable of descending, and I have seen the heights. I have seen how kindness and compassion may grow in the unlikeliest of places, as the mountain flower forces its way through the stern rock.
author: Jacqueline Carey, Kushiel's Dart

quote: Positivity can be a negative," I tell her, "if it's used to diminish events that should be cause for concern. Saying 'bad things happen to good people' or "God doesn't give anyone more than they can handle', for instance, isn't necessarily helpful to the person to whom something bad happened--it is much more beneficial to those who wish to be dismissive- who don't really care to think about the why or how or who. And if we cease to see the real human part in events--if instead, we relegate human experiences to some sort of mystical concept like karma, destiny or everything happens for a reason, and consider more realistic views to be negative--then we diminish compassion and empathy, as well as the possibility of positive change.
author: Jane Devin, Elephant Girl: A Human Story
category: change, compassion, empathy, negative, positive, realistic

quote: Don't be afraid to make corrections," Picchu said. "Don't be afraid to lend a hand." She fell silent, seeming to think for a moment. "And don't look down.
author: Diane Duane, So You Want to Be a Wizard

quote: Unfortunately we treat others as we treat ourselves. We should try being genuinely kind to ourselves and the rest will come naturally, like a Platinum Rule.

category: betterment, compassion, golden-rule, inspiration, kindness, motivation, self-help

quote: Most of us care about one another. Human beings have considerably more in common with one another than they do differences. One’s religion, political persuasion, family, financial and social status, or vocation does not hamper the common thread of personal decency running through most of humankind.
author: Jon M. Huntsman Sr., Essential Lessons on Leadership

quote: All beings seek for happiness

quote: he's not a piece of meat you can job off the market by the pound. because, if you do,maish, if you do, you'll rot in hell.

quote: As I crawled out of the abyss of combat and over the rail of the Sea Runner, I realized that compassion for the sufferings of others is a burden to those who have it. As Wilfred Owen's poem "Insensibility" puts it so well, those who feel most of others suffer most in war.

quote: I will meet you in that gap where consciousness meets unconsciousness.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.

quote: Dreams create desired things.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, dreams, dreams-create-desired-things, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, things

quote: What you think again and again becomes your truth. Think right.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, think, thoughts, truth

quote: Opinions are many, but there is only one truth. Don’t get lost in opinions.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, opinions, philosophy, quotes, truth

quote: Failure comes from fear. Success comes from boldness and persistence.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: boldness-and-persistence, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, failure, fear, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, success

quote: There are many kinds of truth: societal truths, religious truths, fundamental truths, scientific truths, and universal truths. Your truth should be what you can trust with your heart.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, fundamental-truths, inspirational, meaning-of-truth, philosophy, quotes, religious-truths, scientific-truths, societal-truths, truth, types-of-truth, universal-truth

quote: Live in love to live in abundance.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: abundance, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, live, love, philosophy, quotes

quote: Curiosity, boldness, and persistence help you to be a success.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: boldness, curiosity, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, persistence, philosophy, quotes, success

quote: I am part of you and you are part of me. We are one even though we have separate bodies.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, part-of-you, philosophy, quotes, separate-bodies, we-are-one

quote: You have the power to change not only you but also the world.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, power-to-change, power-to-change-the-world, quotes

quote: A good friend is someone who can love you like a dog and talk to you like a human.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, dog, dogs-love, friendship, good-friend, inspirational, love, philosophy, quotes

quote: A lack of love for humanity is our biggest enemy.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha-m-d, humanity, inspirational, love, philosophy, quotes

quote: For eternity, time is standing still. In the expanding space, we are moving
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, eternity, inspirational, philosophy, space, time

quote: Ethics are the moral compass of a human society that change and adjust over time.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, ethics, human-society, moral, moral-compass

quote: We think when there is a stimulation to create thoughts in our minds.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: create-thoughts, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, minds, philosophy, quotes, think

quote: Thoughts are things that we can't see or feel yet.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, thoughts

quote: When you love, the whole universe loves you back.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, love, philosophy, quotes, universe

quote: A country is poor not because they have no wealth but because they have no good ideas.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, good-ideas, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, poor-country, quotes, wealth

quote: We are all the same. Only our thoughts are slightly different.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, equality, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, thoughts, we-are-all-the-same

quote: Hope with deep driving desires is an order of the most delicious delicacy in a restaurant we call the universe.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, desires, hope, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, universe

quote: I have a best friend and he is me.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: best-friend, best-friend-is-me, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, quotes

quote: Let us think to live and love to think.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, love, love-to-think, mridha, philosophy, quotes, think, thinking

quote: In life there is no road to go back
author: we can only go forward.

quote: We can’t undo an action, but we can redo or change our perception.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: change-your-perception, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, perception, philosophy, quotes, we-can-t-undo-an-action

quote: We came out of nothing and we will go back to nothing.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, nothing, philosophy, quotes, we-came-from-nothing, we-will-go-back-to-nothing

quote: You think that you have everything, but truly you have nothing but your wisdom, love, and kindness.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, kindness, love, philosophy, quotes, wisdom, you-think-you-have-everything

quote: Very few people think
author: most people just conform.

quote: Fill the pages of your life with the exciting story of triumph and tragedy, failure and victory, desire and discovery.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, desire, discovery, inspirational, life, life-story, mridha, philosophy, quotes, triumph-and-tragedy, victory

quote: If time is standing still, then why do we allow months and years to let us kill?
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, life, mridha, passage-of-time, philosophy, quotes, time

quote: What you work for, you will receive.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes, what-you-work-for, why-do-we-have-to-work, work

quote: The universal law is very simple, but we look at it in a complex way.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, how-we-look-at-things, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes, universal-law

quote: Life is very simple, but to make ourselves feel intelligent, we insist on making it complex.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, intelligent, life, life-is-very-simple, mridha, philosophy, quotes

quote: Nothing is absolute
author: everything is relative.

quote: Philosophy is the art of conscience.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: conscience, debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes

quote: The best thing in life is life itself.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, life, mridha, philosophy, quotes, the-best-thing-in-life

quote: Life is a journey of time within the mind.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, life, life-is-a-journey, mridha, philosophy, quotes

quote: Always be the right person for the right job at the right time. Remember time is always right.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: be-the-right-person, debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes, right-job, right-person

quote: Conformity keeps us closed minded.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: close-minded, conformity, debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes

quote: No matter where you are--no matter what happens to you--always be kind and always be loving.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: always-be-kind, always-be-loving, debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, kind, loving, mridha, philosophy, quotes

quote: The measure of wisdom is in simplicity, humility, and in friendliness.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, friendliness, humility, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes, simplicity, wisdom

quote: Before we can change our condition, we have to change our thoughts.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: change-our-condition, change-our-thoughts, debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes, thoughts

quote: Thoughts are the product of a machine we call the human mind. So manufacture some excellent thoughts.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, human-mind, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes, thoughts

quote: Our thoughts and our happiness are inseparable. Our happiness depends on our thoughts.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, happiness, inspirational, mridha, philosophy, quotes, thoughts

quote: Life is a time bound journey to experience the excitement of love, joy, and happiness.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish, debasish-mridha-m-d, experience, happiness, inspirational, life-is-a-journey, love, mridha, philosophy, quotes

quote: You call it thought. I call it a mind manufactured invisible powerful product.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, definition-of-thought, inspirational, m-d, philosophy, powerful, thought

quote: Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind
author: the second is to be kind
category: and the third is to be kind.

quote: Do your little bit of good where you are
author: it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.

quote: I hope you will have a wonderful year, that you'll dream dangerously and outrageously, that you'll make something that didn't exist before you made it, that you will be loved and that you will be liked, and that you will have people to love and to like in return. And, most importantly (because I think there should be more kindness and more wisdom in the world right now), that you will, when you need to be, be wise, and that you will always be kind.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: Guard well within yourself that treasure, kindness. Know how to give without hesitation, how to lose without regret, how to acquire without meanness.
author: George Sand

quote: Be a little kinder than you have to.
author: E. Lockhart, We Were Liars

quote: The beauty of a woman is not in a facial mole,but true beauty in a Woman is reflected in her soul. It is the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she knows.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Tenderness and kindness are not signs of weakness and despair, but manifestations of strength and resolution.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: All I'm saying is, kindness don't have no boundaries.
author: Kathryn Stockett, The Help

quote: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: To belittle, you have to be little.
author: Kahlil Gibran, The Prophet

quote: The smallest act of kindness is worth more than the greatest intention.
author: Kahlil Gibran, The Essential Kahlil Gibran

quote: Few will have the greatness to bend history itself, but each of us can work to change a small portion of events. It is from numberless diverse acts of courage and belief that human history is shaped. Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and crossing each other from a million different centers of energy and daring those ripples build a current which can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance.
author: Robert F. Kennedy
category: incrementalism, influence, justice, kindness, make-a-difference, oppression

quote: Never look down on anybody unless you're helping them up.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: Don't be reckless with other people's hearts, and don't put up with people that are reckless with yours.
author: Mary Schmich

quote: I'd thought once, actually, of taking your mind, if you asked. I'd thought I could help you fall asleep at night."He opened his mouth to say something. Shut it again. His face closed for a moment, his unreadable mask falling into place. He spoke softly. "But that wouldn't be fair; for after I slept you'd be left awake, with no one to help you sleep.
author: Kristin Cashore, Fire

quote: Conquer the angry one by not getting angry; conquer the wicked by goodness; conquer the stingy by generosity, and the liar by speaking the
author: Gautama Buddha, The Dhammapada
category: anger, generosity, goodness, inspirational, kindness, knowledge, love, truth, wisdom

quote: ...treat people with understanding when you can, and fake it when you can'tuntil you do understand.
author: Kim Harrison

quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a battle you know nothing about.
author: Wendy Mass, The Candymakers

quote: I must be cruel only to be kind;Thus bad begins, and worse remains behind.
author: William Shakespeare, Hamlet

quote: When we treat people merely as they are, they will remain as they are. When we treat them as if they were what they should be, they will become what they should be.
author: Thomas S. Monson, Pathways To Perfection: Discourses Of Thomas S. Monson

quote: For it is in giving that we receive.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: Always try to be a little kinder than is necessary.
author: J.M. Barrie

quote: He who sees a need and waits to be asked for help is as unkind as if he had refused it.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Never lose a chance of saying a kind word.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray, Vanity Fair

quote: We're all born with selfish desires, so we can all relate to those feelings in others. But kindness is something made individually by each person...so it's easy to misunderstand when others are trying to be kind to you.
author: Natsuki Takaya, Fruits Basket Ultimate Edition, Vol. 3

quote: There is nothing so rewarding as to make people realize that they are worthwhile in this world.
author: Bob Anderson

quote: Never start a sentence with the words 'No offense.
author: Gretchen Rubin, The Happiness Project: Or Why I Spent a Year Trying to Sing in the Morning, Clean My Closets, Fight Right, Read Aristotle, and Generally Have More Fun

quote: You don't always have to chop with the sword of truth. You can point with it too.
author: Anne Lamott, Bird by Bird: Some Instructions on Writing and Life

quote: (I)f we are going to be kind, let it be out of simple generosity, not because we fear guilt or retribution.
author: J.M. Coetzee, Disgrace

quote: Moments of kindness and reconciliation are worth having, even if the parting has to come sooner or later.
author: Alice Munro

quote: A smile remains the most inexpensive gift I can bestow on anyone and yet its powers can vanquish kingdoms.
author: Og Mandino

quote: And so I try to be kind to everything I see, and in everything I see, I see him.
author: Hanya Yanagihara, A Little Life

quote: Be kind. Always if you have a choice, be kind.
author: Anne Rice

quote: I coudn't be kind to him after what he'd done, couldn't be cruel after what I had done
author: Rosamund Hodge, Cruel Beauty

quote: Because I haven't yet learned the simplest and most important thing of all: the world is difficult, and we are all breakable. So just be kind.
author: Caitlin Moran, How to Build a Girl

quote: Treat other people's home as you want them to respect yours because what goes around comes around.
author: Ana Monnar

quote: I respect kindness in human beings first of all, and kindness to animals. I don't respect the law; I have a total irreverence for anything connected with society except that which makes the roads safer, the beer stronger, the food cheaper and the old men and old women warmer in the winter and happier in the summer.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: The various features and aspects of human life, such as longevity, good health, success, happiness, and so forth, which we consider desirable, are all dependent on kindness and a good heart.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: There is no wrong way to perform an act of kindness.
author: Catherine Ryan Hyde, Pay It Forward

quote: Christ came to be Father's compassion to the world. Be kind in your actions. Do not think that you are the only one who can do efficient work, work worth showing. This makes you harsh in your judgment of others who may not have the same talents. Do your best and trust that others do their best. And be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
author: Mother Teresa, In the Heart of the World: Thoughts, Stories and Prayers

quote: If you can't be kind, at least be vague.
author: Judith Martin

quote: Every sunrise is an invitation for us to arise and brighten someone's day.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: charity, generosity, giving, good-deeds, helping, kindness, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: It’s much easier to be cruel than one might think.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Each smallest act of kindness, reverberates across great distances and spans of time --affecting lives unknown to the one who’s generous spirit, was the source of this good echo. Because kindness is passed on and grows each time it’s passed until a simple courtesy becomes an act of selfless courage, years later, and far away. Likewise, each small meanness, each expression of hatred, each act of evil.
author: Dean Koontz, From the Corner of His Eye

quote: Be kind to one another. Bye, bye.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

quote: Practice kindness - particularly when you feel irritated or things are not going well. Kindness hardly ever goes wrong.
author: Lewis Richmond, Work as a Spiritual Practice: A Practical Buddhist Approach to Inner Growth and Satisfaction on the Job

quote: Choose being kind over being right and you'll be right every time.
author: Richard Carlson

quote: You own everything that happened to you. Tell your stories. If people wanted you to write warmly about them, they should've behaved better.
author: Anne Lamott, Bird by Bird: Some Instructions on Writing and Life
category: authenticity, genuineness, honesty, kindness, self-awareness, truth-telling

quote: Be kind, because everyone is having a really hard time.
author: Plato

quote: Remember!--It is Christianity to do good always--even to those who do evil to us. It is Christianity to love our neighbours as ourself, and to do to all men as we would have them do to us. It is Christianity to be gentle, merciful and forgiving, and to keep those qualities quiet in our own hearts, and never make a boast of them or of our prayers or of our love of God, but always to show that we love Him by humbly trying to do right in everything. If we do this, and remember the life and lessons of Our Lord Jesus Christ, and try to act up to them, we may confidently hope that God will forgive us our sins and mistakes, and enable us to live and die in peace.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Be kind to people and don’t judge, for you do not know what demons they carry and what battles they are fighting.
author: Vashti Quiroz-Vega

quote: Withhold a smile only when the smile can hurt someone. Otherwise, let it bloom forth in a riot.
author: Vera Nazarian, The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration
category: benefit, harm, kindness, mercy, smile, smiling, timing, well-wishing

quote: You can't live a perfect day without doing something for someone who will never be able to repay you.
author: Debbie Macomber, One Simple Act: Discovering the Power of Generosity

quote: The happiest people I have known have been those who gave themselves no concern about their own souls, but did their uttermost to mitigate the miseries of others.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton, History of Woman Suffrage, Volumes I-III

quote: But remember, boy, that a kind act can sometimes be as powerful as a sword. As a mortal, I was never a great fighter or athlete or poet. I only made wine. The people in my village laughed at me. They said I would never amount to anything. Look at me now. Sometimes small things can become very large indeed.
author: Rick Riordan, The Battle of the Labyrinth

quote: I expect to pass through life but once. If therefore there be any kindness I can show...let me do it now.
author: William Penn

quote: The wine god sighed. 'Oh Hades if I know. But remember, boy, that a kind act can sometimes be as powerful as a sword. As a mortal, I was never a great fighter or athlete or poet. I only made wine. The people in my village laughed at me. They said I would never amount to anything. Look at me now. Sometimes small things can become very large indeed.' He left me alone to think about that. And as I watched Clarisse and Chris singing a stupid campfire song together, holding hands in the darkness, where they thought nobody could see them, I had to smile.
author: Rick Riordan, The Battle of the Labyrinth
category: cute, gods, greek, greek-gods, greek-mythology, inspirational, kindness, percy-jackson, smile, wine-god

quote: If we have the opportunity to be generous with our hearts, ourselves, we have no idea of the depth and breadth of love's reach.
author: Margaret Cho

quote: When you are behaving as if you loved someone, you will presently come to love him. If you injure someone you dislike, you will find yourself disliking him more. If you do him a good turn, you will find yourself disliking him less.
author: C.S. Lewis, Mere Christianity
category: behavior, dislike, good-turns, injury, kindness, like, love

quote: He is as full of valor as of kindness. Princely in both.
author: William Shakespeare, Henry V

quote: They weren't nice words he said. He could've lived a good life and died never having made a person feel rubbed down to bones and too sad to hold together.
author: Shannon Hale, Book of a Thousand Days

quote: What virtue is there in a man who demonstrates goodness because he has been bred to it? It is his habit from youth. But a man who has known unkindness and want, for him to be kind and charitable to those who have been the cause of his misfortunes, that is a virtuous man.
author: Deanna Raybourn, Silent on the Moor

quote: A yogi is much more disciplined in his speech. Yogic tradition has it that speech must pass before three barriers prior to being uttered aloud. These barriers come in the form of three questions: Is it kind? Is it true? Is it necessary? (112-113)
author: Prem Prakash, The Yoga of Spiritual Devotion A Modern Translation of the Narada Bhakti Sutras

quote: This is what kindness does, Ms.Albert said. Each little thing we do goes out, like a ripple, into the world.
author: Jacqueline Woodson, Each Kindness

quote: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures.The more he gives to others,the more he has for his own.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Human kindness has never weakened the stamina or softened the fiber of a free people. A nation does not have to be cruel to be tough.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Now is a time for, dare I say it, kindness. I thought being extremely smart would take care of it. But I see I have been found out.
author: Margaret Edson, Wit

quote: Thousands of years ago, man lived in harmony with the rest of the natural world. Through what we would today call Telepathy, he communicated with animals, plants, and other forms of life-none of which he considered "beneath" himself, only different, with different jobs to perform. He worked side by side with earth angels and nature spirits, with whom he shared responsibility for taking care of the world.
author: Benjamin Hoff, The Te of Piglet

quote: Ravens bring things to people. We're like that. It's our nature. We don't like it.
author: Peter S. Beagle, A Fine and Private Place

quote: they say it's like true love, good help. you only get one in a lifetime.....there is so much you don't know about a person. i wonder if i could've made her days a little bit easier, if I'd tried. if i'd treated her a little nicer.....
author: Kathryn Stockett

quote: Kindness trumps everything. Kind people are magnets for all of the good things in life.
author: Tom Giaquinto, Be A Good Human

quote: I drop kindness pebbles in still water everyday, and I watch the effect they have on other people’s lives.My favorite kindness pebbles are compliments.Drop a compliment and watch the ripple affect that it has in your life.
author: JohnA Passaro, Again

quote: It is not about how much money we make or how big and powerful our work appears to others, it is about the love with which we put into each act of kindness toward another human being.
author: Joyce Vissell

quote: Life is short and we have never too much time for gladdening the hearts of those who are traveling the dark journey with us. Oh, be swift to love, make haste to be kind.
author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel, Amiel's Journal

quote: But she was not even grateful to him for it; nothing good on Pierre's part seemed to her to be an effort, it seemed so natural for him to be kind to everyone that there was no merit in his kindness.
author: Leo Tolstoy, War and Peace

quote: His kindness was only meant to make later torments crueler.
author: Rosamund Hodge, Cruel Beauty

quote: Be kind, be all sympathy,For each and every human beingIs forced to fight against himself.
author: Sri Chinmoy, My Life's Soul-Journey: Daily Meditations for Ever-Increasing Spiritual Fulfillment

quote: A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.
author: Roy  Bennett

quote: Sometimes those who give the most are the ones with the least to spare.
author: Mike  McIntyre, The Kindness of Strangers

quote: Capable, generous men do not create victims, they nurture victims.
author: Julian Assange

quote: Once you begin to acknowledge random acts of kindness - both the ones you have received and the ones you have given - you can no longer believe that what you do does not matter.
author: Dawna Markova

quote: Life is short and we have never too much time for gladdening the hearts of those who are travelling the dark journey with us. Oh be swift to love, make haste to be kind.
author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel

quote: If there is such a thing as a universal--and I wasn't ready to throw all of mine out the window--it's that there is power in a story. And if someone pays you such a kindness as to make up a tale so you'll enjoy a gingersnap, you go along with that story and enjoy every last bite.
author: Clare Vanderpool, Moon Over Manifest

quote: Nothing carries more potential for change than individual acts of human kindness.
author: Jamie Winship

quote: Royse Bergon: "I've seen your integrity in action. It...widened my world. I'd been raised by my father, who is a prudent, cautious man, always looking for men's hidden, selfish motivations. No one can cheat him. But I've seen him cheat himself. If you understand what I mean."Caz: "Yes."R.B.: "It was very foolish of you to attack that vile Roknari galley-man."Caz: "Yes."R.B.: "And yet, I think, given the same circumstances you would do it again."Caz: "Knowing what I know now...it would be harder. But I would hope... I would pray, Royse, that the gods would still lend me such foolishness in my need."R.B: "What is this astonishing foolishness, that shines brighter than all my father's gold? Can you teach me to be such a fool, too, Caz?"Caz: "Oh," "I'm sure of it.
author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quote: I couldn't shake the impulse to help him. It seemed that the older I got the more I believed that everyone, homeless or not, deserved to be treated at least like a human.
author: Julia Karr, XVI

quote: Be kind to yourself, so you can be happy enough to be kind to the world.
author: Misha Collins

quote: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.-Dalai Lama
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote: Give until it hurts.
author: Corazon Cojuangco Aquino

quote: I have wept in the nightAt my shortness of sightThat to others' needs made me blind,But I never have yetHad a twinge of regretFor being a little too kind.
author: C.R. Gibson

quote: I’m not denying their kindness,” said the Rani. “But after all kindness isn’t the only virtue.
author: Aldous Huxley, Island

quote: Men are like children, in that, if you spoil them, they become naughty. Therefore it is well not to be too indulgent or charitable with anyone. You may take it as a general rule that you will not lose a friend by refusing him a loan, but that you are very likely to do so by granting it; and, for similar reasons, you will not readily alienate people by being somewhat proud and careless in your behavior; but if you are very kind and complaisant towards them, you will often make them arrogant and intolerable, and so a breach will ensue.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer, The Wisdom of Life and Counsels and Maxims

quote: I wish stories were kinder to their characters," Maddie said. "But I guess trouble is more interesting to read about.
author: Shannon Hale, A Wonderlandiful World

quote: When a cat flatters ... he is not insincere: you may safely take it for real kindness.
author: Walter Savage Landor, Imaginary Conversations

quote: A selfless act out of even the purest desire to do for others, will be selfish in the satisfaction and happiness it brings to one doing it.
author: Ashly Lorenzana, Sex, Drugs, and Being an Escort

quote: There was a time when a new deputy tried to teach Mr. Fruit about the difference between a red and a green light, but Mr. Fruit had resisted all efforts to reorder what he had been doing perfectly well for many years. He had not only monitored the comings and goings of the town, his presence softened the ingrained evil that flourished along the invisible margins of the town’s consciousness. Any community can be judged in its humanity or corruption by how it manages to accommodate the Mr. Fruits of the world. Colleton simply adjusted itself to Mr. Fruit’s harmonies and ordinations. He did whatever he felt was needed and he did it with style. “That’s the Southern way” my grandmother said. “That’s the nice way.
author: Pat Conroy, The Prince of Tides

quote: If you put out acceptance and warmth, you tend to attract the same.
author: Deborah Day

quote: Rather than being a human, be a humanitarian
author: Kowtham Kumar K

quote: To you, whoever you are, when I am gone — remember to be kind tonight to some lonely person. For me.
author: Tennessee Williams, Notebooks

quote: To reprove a harm-doer, put him to shame by doing a good deed in return.
author: Thiruvalluvar, Thirukkural
category: act, action, activity, deeds, evil, good, harm, kindness, love, shame, virtue

quote: Give and receive
author: give big and receive big

quote: One of the most difficult things to give away is kindness, for it is usually returned.
author: Mark Ortman

quote: George put his hand on top of Beatrice's and felt the warmth of both the woman and her hound pulsing through his fingers. "Just because your father does not see your victory does not mean that it is none," he said softly.
author: Mette Ivie Harrison, The Princess and the Hound

quote: Kindness is stronger than iron bars.
author: Margaret George, Mary Queen of Scotland and The Isles

quote: Kindness is like a muscle, the more we exercise it the better we are at it.Kindness starts as a thought but ends as an action. Acting kindly toward others is the only real way to let people know we care about them and their happiness. Without action, kindness just lives in our minds but never touches the real world.Being kind to others doesn’t have to be complex or fancy. Sometimes the simplest acts of kindness are seen as the most sincere, such as holding the door, helping with directions, saying “please” and “thank you,” or even just a smile.
author: Steven Handel

quote: The Librarian was not familiar with love, which had always struck him as a bit ethereal and soppy, but kindness, on the other hand, was practical. You knew where you were with kindness, especially if you were holding a pie it had just given you.
author: Terry Pratchett, Unseen Academicals

quote: Ask yourself: Have you been kind today? Make kindness your daily modus operandi and change your world.
author: Annie Lennox

quote: In reality punk people are usually the gentlest, kindest folks you'll ever know. They're like hippies, only they wear way more black.
author: Kate Rockland, Falling Is Like This

quote: Kindness is a much more crushing force than anger.
author: Samael Aun Weor, Revolution of the Dialectic: Esoteric Psychology and Meditation

quote: I love thee for a heart that’s kind--not for the knowledge in thy mind.
author: W.H. Davies

quote: Even the smallest act of service, the simplest act of kindness, is a way to honor those we lost; a way to reclaim that spirit of unity that followed 9/11.
author: Barack Obama
category: 9-11, honor, kindness, reclaim, service, spirit, unity

quote: Wouldn’t this old world be better If the folks we meet would say: ‘I know something good about you,’ And then treat us that way?
author: N. Eldon Tanner

quote: Human beings who leave behind them no great achievements, but only a series of small kindnesses, have not had wasted lives
author: Charlotte Gray

quote: For the multifold secret to work only one thing is necessary. You must take action. You must give. You must share. You must act with abandon. Send out waves of love and kindness into the world and then simply wait for the response. Or, better yet, continue to send out more waves. Why wait? The response will come. Keep sending waves and enjoy the reaction.
author: John Kremer

quote: I required kindness and sympathy, but I did not believe myself utterly unworthy of it.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

quote: I know most people want others to have good lives, and, when they understand the situation, they will do what they can to steer the world back toward kindness. This is when human beings, I believe, are most admirable.
author: Daoud Hari

quote: Lift up your eyes and see the good in the world, for we are people with an amazing capacity to do great good. And if only the minority choose to exercise this capacity to the smallest degree, oh how wondrous and sweet the deeds performed at but a few hands!
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-good, charity, do-good, doing-good, good-in-the-world, goodness, helping-others, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, see-the-good

quote: Be nice. And if you can't do that, just don't be mean.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: kindness, love, nice, richelle, richelle-goodrich, self-control, tolerance

quote: The real trouble is that 'kindness' is a quality fatally easy to attribute to ourselves on quite inadequate grounds. Everyone feels benevolent if nothing happens to be annoying him at the moment. Thus a man easily comes to console himself for all his other vices by a conviction that 'his heart's in the right place' and 'he wouldn't hurt a fly,' though in fact he has never made the slightest sacrifice for a fellow creature. We think we are kind when we are only happy: it is not so easy, on the same grounds, to imagine oneself temperate, chaste, or humble.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Problem of Pain

quote: ...to be unkind because you are thoughtless is the worst kind of blindness.
author: Cameron Dokey, Golden:  A Retelling of Rapunzel

quote: They told me adventures were over, so I got off the internet and got on a plane. They told me kindness was a thing of the past, so I spent a year helping others in need. They told me love was dead, so I fell into it. Head over heels.
author: Abby Lass

quote: Needing kindness myself, I am kinder now, and we get on amazingly well. [p. 110]
author: Lionel Shriver, We Need to Talk About Kevin

quote: On the way home I absently minded (you know what I mean) went through a stop sign in Hyannis so of course there was a police car to apprehend me. A soft answer turnethed away wrath, fortunately.
author: Edward Gorey, Floating Worlds: The Letters of Edward Gorey & Peter F. Neumeyer

quote: Big cities can have big hearts.
author: Mary Elise Monsell, The Mysterious Cases of Mr. Pin

quote: Kindness is a girl's best friend.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: a-girl-s-best-friend, best-friend, kind, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: It seemed like an original act, the very kindest act of being human, that he listened.
author: Sue Woolfe, The Secret Cure

quote: Generosity brings you respect from people and those who are miser get hatred from people.
author: Abrar Ahmed chowdhury

quote: Cookies are happy, because that is their job. Making those you know, and don't know happy. They tell people you care.
author: Brent M. Jones

quote: We often look for kindness back  in the same place we gave it, and mostly that is where  we go wrong.  Kindness does not work that way,  you put your kind deeds into the universe and the universe  reflects back that energy  into your life, from unexpected  avenues at most appropriate  times.
author: Drishti Bablani

quote: Try going out of your comfort zone and doing something for someone else.
author: Henry Hon, ONE: Unfolding God's Eternal Purpose from House to House

quote: They were with him, and for that little while the darkness was kind.
author: Stephen King, It

quote: Accepting others through kindness and love defines a person's true character.
author: Rick W. Terry

quote: Just like small acts of kindness can pave the way for a better world, small acts of corruption open the road for a corrupt world.
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: I choose to walkwith gratitude, not envy; with faith, not worry; with confidence, not fear; with kindness, not anger.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life
category: confidence-quotes, faith-quotes, gratitude, gratitude-quotes, kindness, kindness-quotes

quote: A gift.A gift from a queen who had seen another woman in hell and thought to reach back a hand. With no thought of it ever being returned. A moment of kindness, a tug on a thread.
author: Sarah J. Maas, Tower of Dawn

quote: That day, I learned that I could be a giver by simply bringing a smile to another person. The ensuing years have taught me that a kind word, a vote of support is a charitable gift. I can move over and make another place for someone. I can turn my music up if it pleases, or down if it is annoying. I may never be known as a philanthropist, but I certainly am a lover of mankind, and I will give freely of my resources.
author: Maya Angelou, Letter to My Daughter

quote: Do not underestimate the strength it takes to be the hearth everyone turns to for warmth.
author: Megan Derr, The Painted Crown

quote: Don’t judge people in their reduced circumstances, nobody aspires to be there.
author: Shon Mehta

quote: Sweet mother Mary, boy, think about what you’re doing! Be cruel or be kind, but don’t be both, because now you’ve made a mess you can’t clean up in a hurry.
author: Ursula Vernon, Jackalope Wives

quote: Nothing can make a face more impenetrable than the mask of kindliness.
author: André Gide, Isabelle

quote: A simple act of kindness and compassion towards a single animal may not mean anything to all creatures, but will mean everything to one.
author: Paul Oxton
category: africa, animal-rights, animal-welfare, animals, kindness, wildlife, wildlife-conservation

quote: I carry your kindness wherever I go. That way your love touches far more than just me.
author: Lynda Cheldelin Fell

quote: Be kind to all pets and animals because they will be kind back to you.
author: J. Wesley Porter, A Spiritual Dog: "Bear"
category: affection, animals, kind, kindness, love, pets

quote: the kind peopleare running this worldthey don't know how their one little smile has saved many lives
author: Noor Unnahar, Yesterday I Was the Moon

quote: Why have your followers all drawn their swords, may I ask?" said Aslan."May it please Your High Majesty," said the second Mouse, whose name was Peepiceek, "we are all waiting to cut off our own tails if our Chief must go without his. We will not bear the shame of wearing an honor which is denied to the High Mouse.""Ah!" roared Aslan. "You have conquered me. You have great hearts. Not for the sake of your dignity, Reepicheep, but for the love that is between you and your people, and still more for the kindness your people showed me long ago when you ate away the cords that bound me on the Stone Table (and it was then, though you have long forgotten it, that you began to be Talking Mice), you shall have your tail again.
author: C.S. Lewis, Prince Caspian

quote: Kindness danced through the streets,leaving warmer hearts and smiles everywhere it dared to show itself.
author: Scott Stabile

quote: Our own random acts of kindness allow us to receive a gift each day in our hearts.
author: Ron Baratono
category: acts, gift, hearts, kindness, random, receive

quote: If you’re in a position to lift someone off the ground
author: i.
category: Say nothing about what it cost you to ii.

quote: Do not confuse kindness with weakness. Kindness is a dying art. It is the single most important quality in this world and one which is sorely lacking.
author: James Rhodes, Instrumental: A Memoir of Madness, Medication, and Music

quote: How do you make me smile when it seems like there’s nothing in the whole world to smile about?
author: Paula Stokes, Ferocious

quote: There are certain lesson you pick up gradually as you go, letting them accumulate after a series of similar mistakes or experiences until you finally realize you've been a fool al along. And then there are lessons that are so massive they smack you in the face - you don't reflect on a period of your life and realize, 'Oh, I learned something then'; you know it's happening when it's happening. The importance of kindness - which extends far beyond 'please,' 'thank you,' and 'your hair doesn't look bad today' - is a combination of both: Over and over in my life, I've been bowled over by how kind people can be, and how that kindness can change your outlook.
author: Alyssa Mastromonaco, Who Thought This Was a Good Idea?: And Other Questions You Should Have Answers to When You Work in the White House

quote: Larry (Summers - director of the National Economic Council) taught me two very important lessons. The first: Never judge a book by its cover (or the articles written about it). The second: Always make time to help a gal out. Kindness - you can call it generosity, or goodwill - really means something.
author: Alyssa Mastromonaco

quote: [We] need people who are kind by instinct, not by effort. But that is what we lack in this time. For progress, we have eaten our souls up, and nothing matters anymore.
author: Claire North, The First Fifteen Lives of Harry August

quote: You are positively beautiful and I love you. Pass it on…
author: Scott Stabile

quote: Tommy and I put on a radio play to entertain everyone while they unpacked their cookies. It was about a girl who saves up money for a prom dress, but at the last minute she says, "It's only clothes," and buys war bonds instead. The play was a big success, and my whole school pledged to buy war bonds, which should have made me happy. But it gave me a queer feeling; it's easy to write propaganda when everyone agrees with you. Do you understand? I think I'd rather bake cookies; it feels more honest. Your friend, LuluSammy looked down at me. "A girl after your own heart!" he said. "In my experience it is a rare female who can say, 'It's only clothes,' and when the war came, you discovered who you really were. Women changed. Children grew up overnight. I wonder what happened to this one.
author: Ruth Reichl, Delicious!

quote: Kindness is Love for Unknown.
author: Gollapalli Nithin Kumar

quote: Kindness: It's ours to share.
author: Anthony T. Hincks

quote: The spirit of Christmas is a sweet, internal peace that testifies of the power of kindness and charity.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: charity, christmas, christmas-quotes, christmas-spirit, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, spirit-of-christmas

quote: The Christmas spirit is simply an honest spirit of love for all humanity. It is the force that moves us to give what we can, to help as we are able, and to always be of kind comfort.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: christmas, christmas-quotes, christmas-spirit, comfort, kindness, love, loving-others, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Jusging by the sour glance she threw on me as she said this, I concluded that I represented those 'late changes' to which all the sorrows of the house were referred. I felt unhappy under the ill-will even of this odious old woman, being one of those unhappily constructed mortals who cannot be indifferent when they reasonably ought, and always yearn after kindness, even that of the worthless.
author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu, Uncle Silas

quote: So you want to improve the world? Then do it. To the next person who crosses your path, say something kind, do something generous, perform a simple act of service. By doing this on a regular basis, you will indeed improve the world.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: charity, everyday-acts-of-service, improve-the-world, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, service, volunteer

quote: My shoulders, broad and sculpted thick, were designed for two useful purposes. The one, to carry heavy loads like cedar logs and beams of steel and now and then the careful transfer of an injured friend to a bed of safety. The other purpose I consider superior, and that is to be, in all circumstances and forever, your headrest and cry pillow whereupon you may leave your heaviest burdens.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: assist, caring, carry-burdens, carry-heavy-loads, charity, comforter, consoling, help, helping-others, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Imagine the greatness this world would know if kindness were as contagious and enduring as the common cold.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-kind, be-nice, kindness, kindness-is-contagious, niceness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: So what if you’re right? So what if you’re wrong? In the end you might be surprised to find that God doesn’t care so much about whether you were right or wrong but whether, despite it all, you were kind or cruel.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-kind, cruel, cruelty, kind, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, right, right-or-wrong, wrong

quote: Learning to breathe fire isn’t nearly as extraordinary as learning to breathe a word of kindness.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: breathe-fire, extraordinary, kind-words, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, words-of-kindness

quote: You would think those who have endured unkindness would be kinder as a result, intent on sparing others the awful suffering they abhorred firsthand.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: endurance, enduring-unkindness, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: The ideal man, takes joy in doing favours for others; but he feels ashamed to have others do favours for him. For it is a mark of superiority to confer a kindness; but it is a mark of inferiority to receive it.
author: Aristotle

quote: Malice is a greater magnifying-glass than kindness.
author: George Savile Halifax

quote: I am convinced that I never wrong anyone intentionally...
author: Socrates, Apology, Crito and Phaedo of Socrates.

quote: The pleasure of kindness is that it connects us with others; but the terror of kindness is that it makes us too immediately aware of our own and other people’s vulnerabilities (vulnerabilities that we are prone to call failings when we are at our most frightened). Vulnerability—particularly the vulnerability we call desire—is our shared biological inheritance. Kindness, in other words, opens us up to the world (and worlds) of other people in ways that we both long for and dread. How can people, from childhood onward, feel confident enough to take such risks?
author: Adam Phillips, On Kindness

quote: People are so scared of what they don't know.
author: Caitlin Alifirenka, I Will Always Write Back: How One Letter Changed Two Lives

quote: I don’t know how to save the world, though I do know it involves a great deal of love and kindness.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: kindness, love, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, save-the-world

quote: Life isn’t always kind. It isn’t gentle and loving or sympathetic to the pains and sorrows of humanity. I, however, as an individual in control of my own actions, can be kind and loving, gentle and sympathetic to those around me, and in the process improve what life is for everyone.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: agency, be-kind, be-nice, improve-the-world, kind, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Nature blessed every person with the innate capacity to express wonder and awe for the eternal world and act with a kind and unstinting soul.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: beauty-in-nature, enlightenment-principles, kind-soul, kind-spirit, kindness, kindness-quotes, magnanimous

quote: What gives a person’s brief time on this planet meaning is engaging in small acts of kindness. Bestowing an act of kindness upon other people is the greatest gift that a person will ever give to other people and such acts shall renew the gifting person. When we unreservedly accept and love our brethren, we become the ineluctable wind that vivifies the lives of other people.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls

quote: Out of all the magic words in existence, kind words produce the most powerful transformation spells.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-kind, kind, kind-words, kindness, magic-words, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Keep pollinating the world with your kindness.
author: H.L. Balcomb, Cinderella In Focus: "Curiosity is the doorway to our personal possibility!" 2nd Edition coming Oct.  31, 2017
category: cinderellainfocus, fairy-tales-for-adults, hlbalcomb, hope-quotes, kindness, kindness-quotes

quote: It’s easy to be kind to friends who return your smiles and happily lend a helping hand. But the true test of good character is finding the will and desire to be kind and charitable to those who give us absolutely no motivation to do so.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: be-charitable, be-kind, character, charity, good-character, kind, kindness, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: We often look for kindness back in the same place we gave it, and mostly that is where we go wrong.Kindness does not work that way, you put your kind deeds into the universe and the universe reflects back that energy into your life, from unexpected avenues at most appropriate times.
author: Drishti Bablani, Wordions

quote: I have my own peculiar yardstick for measuring a man: Does he have the courage to cry in a moment of grief? Does he have the compassion not to hunt an animal? In his relationship with a woman, is he gentle?
