I often say to our students, in the course of my talks to them on Sunday evenings in the chapel, that the longer I live and the more experience I have of the world, the more I am convinced that, after all, the one thing that is most worth living for -- and dying for, if need be -- is the opportunity of making some one else more happy and more useful.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Our thoughts dictate how we feel
author: so it is important to recognize that we are as we think we are

quote: If only [there] really was a door and [you] could walk through it into another life, where threads didn't snarl and stitches didn't go all tight and tiny. Where people loved you and didn't leave you for someone else.
author: Karen Hancock, The Shadow Within

quote: Strength is incomprehensible by weakness, and, therefore, the more terrible.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne, The House of the Seven Gables

quote: Sometimes when you had a thought, it refused to leave. You rejected it, disowned it, sent it away, to find, moments later, that you were still spending time with it. It might have a different shape or use different words, but there was no mistaking: it was the same one.
author: Cecilia Ekbäck, Wolf Winter

quote: thoughts are cheap and they don't hurt anybody
author: Martha Brooks, Mistik Lake

quote: Successful people don't have a limit whereas unsuccessful people often draw a line of limit
author: Santosh Avvannavar, Black, Grey and White

quote: Beauty lies in the eyes of the beholder. Most of my beholders are blind.
author: Basith, Autopsy of the seasons

quote: The surveillance, he thought, essentially should be maintained. And, if possible, by me. I should always be watching, watching and figuring out, even if I never do anything about what I see; even if I just sit there and observe silently, not seen: that is important, that I as a watcher of all that happens should be at my place.
author: Philip K. Dick, A Scanner Darkly

quote: Probably nothing, but it was one of those thoughts like toothpaste: Once it’s out, you can’t squeeze it back in.
author: Kate Brady, One Scream Away

quote: The scatterbrain,is a little like,the patter of rain.Neither here,nor there,but everywhere.
author: Lang Leav, Love & Misadventure

quote: Sometimes it's the tiniest things that can mean the difference between life and death.
author: Anthony Horowitz, Ark Angel

quote: We are not trapped by our thoughts. What we generally do, however, is create thoughts that trap us.” (p.162)
author: Joshua David Stone, A Beginner's Guide to the Path of Ascension (The Ascension Series)

quote: I don't know what I'd do without you. There's no one else to look after me. And it's not just that. I sometimes think you're the only person who really knows me. I only feel normal when I'm with you.
author: Anthony Horowitz, Ark Angel

quote: What I mean is that those thoughts, they're human. And just because you turn out differently than everyone's imagined you would doesn't mean that you've failed in some way. A kid who gets teased in one school might move to a different one, and be the most popular girl there, just because no one has any other expectations of her. Or a person who goes to med school because his entire family is full of doctors might find out that what he really wants to be is an artist instead.
author: Jodi Picoult, My Sister's Keeper

quote: Thoughts are strange creatures. They lead you from one thing to another. Sometimes you don’t know how you got from one to the next.
author: Franny Billingsley, Chime

quote: The seed of every sin known to man is in my heart”.
author: Robert Murray McCheyne

quote: For there is no creature whose inward being is so strong that it is not greatly determined by what lies outside it.
author: George Eliot, Middlemarch

quote: ...being able to listen to unrepeatable secrets, wishes, and desires wasn't as wonderful as it seemed...being aware of what other people felt at every moment would come to cause him a lot of headaches, and huge disappointments in love.
author: Laura Esquivel, Swift as Desire

quote: I want to douse myself in silver words and whisper away all rue.
author: Basith, Autopsy of the seasons

quote: It was one of those days when I was thinking too much, too fast. Only it was more like the thoughts had a mind of their own and going all by themselves at a hundred miles a second, and I was just sitting back, feeling the growing paranoia inside of me.
author: Sasha Mizaree

quote: The thoughts of othersWere light and fleeting,Of lovers' meetingOr luck or fame.Mine were of trouble,And mine were steady;So I was readyWhen trouble came.
author: A.E. Housman, More Poems
category: fame, individual, love, lovers, luck, thoughts, trouble

quote: I sit up in bed and watch her fiddle about in the back of my wardrobe. I think she's got a plan. That's what's good about Zoey. She'd better hurry up though, because I'm starting to think of things like carrots. And air. And ducks. And pear trees. Velvet and silk. Lakes. I'm going to miss ice. And the sofa. And the lounge. And the way Cal loves magic tricks. And white things- milk, snow, swans.
author: Jenny Downham, Before I Die

quote: I forced myself to stop thinking about it. I went to the room in my brain where all my thoughts about Adam lived and disconnected the electricity and boarded up all the doors and windows, so nothing could get out.Obviously it was very unsightly. There were bound to be complaints from the neighboring thoughts. But I had no choice.
author: Marian Keyes, Watermelon

quote: That’s how Ptolemy imagined the disposition of his memories, his thoughts: they were still his, still in the range of his thinking, but they were, many and most of them, locked on the other side a closed door that he’s lost the key for. So his memory became like secrets held away from his own mind. But these secrets were noisy things; they babbled and muttered behind the door, and so if he listened closely he might catch a snatch of something he once knew well.
author: Walter Mosley, The Last Days of Ptolemy Grey

quote: Synergy between thoughts and feelings reads the universe like an opened book.
author: Toba Beta, My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: And what do I think about? What thoughts do I have! - What thoughts! a whole host, multitude, and world of thoughts, I keep devising new ones and reworking old ones, some of the old ones are concluded and are only thought of as conclusions, whole worlds of new ones come crashing into my fingers, and it never ends.
author: Jack Kerouac, Windblown World: The Journals of Jack Kerouac 1947-1954

quote: Thoughts are slippery fish in a cold shallow s
author: Vera Nazarian, The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration

quote: How readily our thoughts swarm upon a new object, lifting it a little way, as ants carry a blade of straw so feverishly, and then leave it.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: While she lay there with these old worn thoughts coming obediently into her mind, called there by habit and the familiar quiet of early morning, she was aware that at the back of her mind there was another thought that was not at all stale, but so fresh that it was nearly a feeling, with all a feeling's delicious power to kill thought.
author: Stella Gibbons, Nightingale Wood

quote: Two thoughts cannot coexist at the same time: if the clear light of mindfulness is present, there is no room for mental twilight.
author: Nyanaponika Thera

quote: Never underestimate the power of thought
author: it is the greatest path to discovery.
category: Idowu Koyenikan, Wealth for All: Living a Life of Success at the Edge of Your Ability

quote: but there was nothing I could do to dim the supernovae exploding inside my brain, an endless chain of intra cranial firecrackers
author: John Green

quote: Some things, it was better not to think about. It just made you mad and angry.
author: Paolo Bacigalupi, The Drowned Cities

quote: You are not the mind itself. For You are the Lord God of the mind. All these things are liable to change, but You remain immutable above all things.
author: Augustine of Hippo, Confessions

quote: If you want victory in your life you must learn to be alone with your own thoughts and cause them to be correct thoughts!
author: Sandra Hersey, Help! I'm Alone with My Mind!: A Guide to Having Victory over Your Thoughts

quote: Men employ speech only to conceal their thoughts.
author: Voltaire, Dialogues satiriques  philosophiques: suivis du sermon des cinquante

quote: she looked up at the stars and gave Tibby thanks. She didn't have to throw her thoughts far to know they reached her.
author: Ann Brashares, Sisterhood Everlasting

quote: Never take someone for granted based on your perception and act on it, for that would yield in ultimate disaster!
author: Ramana Pemmaraju
category: difference-of-opinion, disaster, feelings, mindset, people-relations, perception-of-reality, thoughts

quote: I struggled to think pure thoughts, as Hector sucked out my psyche with his eyes.
author: Tahir Shah, House of the Tiger King: The Quest for a Lost City

quote: Governments do not create, individuals create. Every invention was once just a thought inside someones head.
author: William J. Federer, Change to Chains-The 6,000 Year Quest for Control -Volume I-Rise of the Republic

quote: But he wasn't really thinking properly. It was as if the thoughts were chasing each other round and round his head without managing to catch up with each other.
author: Isabel Hoving, The Dream Merchant

quote: There is no such thing as a secret mind or secret me apart from the Lord.
author: Kevin Thoman

quote: It is commonplace to talk as if the world "has" meaning, to ask what "is" the meaning of a phrase, a gesture, a painting, a contract. Yet when thought about, it is clear that events are devoid of meaning until someone assigns it to them.
author: Dean C. Barnlund

quote: Nothing has a greater influence over your life than your thoughts rather they are negative or positive.
author: Tasha Hoggatt

quote: He wore the evidence of thinking all over his face, open and easy to read. Leah envied him that confidence to show what he was feeling.
author: Lauren Dane, Taking Care of Business

quote: His jargon conceals, from him, but not from us, the deep, empty hole in his mind. He uses technological language as a substitute for technique.
author: Richard Mitchell, Less Than Words Can Say

quote: The thing with thoughts is that they die, like everything else. But almost everything else leaves a trace behind, even if it's a tiny carcass, some proof that it existed. Unless thoughts are spoken or written or sung or acted upon, there's no evidence that they were ever there.
author: Adi Alsaid

quote: The purpose of a chronicler of moods and deeds does not require him to express his personal views upon the grave controversy above given.
author: Thomas Hardy, Jude the Obscure

quote: If the components of the body were organs and veins and cells, then the components of thought and language were words and grammar.
author: John Burnside, The Dumb House

quote: It was not the first time - it was far from the firs time - that Damask had suspected that there was something queer, something quite out of the ordinary about her mind. Most people had minds which dealt with one thought, and then another, one at a time. Hers very often dealt with two, even three, all at the same time."Damask Greenway from Afternoon of an Autocrat
author: Norah Lofts, Afternoon of  an Autocrat

quote: Perhaps I am a man of exceptional moods. I do not know how far my experience is common. At times I suffer from the strangest sense of detachment from myself and the world about me; I seem to watch it all from the outside, from somewhere inconceivably remote, out of time, out of space, out of the stress and tragedy of it all. This feeling was very strong upon me that night. Here was another side to my dream.
author: H.G. Wells, The War of the Worlds

quote: We reflect the color of our thoughts
author: Brent M. Jones

quote: A decision is not an incident, it is result of hundreds of circumstances and thousands of thoughts.
author: Mahrukh

quote: Nurses came to his house to work with Morrie's withering legs.. bending them back and forth as if pumping water from a well.. He met with meditation teachers, and closed his eyes and narrowed his thoughts until his world shrunk down to a single breath, in and out, in and out.
author: Mitch Albom, Tuesdays with Morrie

quote: It's a wonderful thought that everyday has something to celebrate.
author: Millie Florence, Honey Butter

quote: Your body is made of two things: your will to do, your ego, and the physical form you have received from the prakriti, the nature. If the will to do is present within you, then the nature will go on providing you with an appropriate body. This is how you have been born again and again. Sometimes you were an animal, sometimes a bird, a tree some other time, and sometimes a man. Whatsoever you wished to achieve, it has happened. Your desire to achieve becomes the actuality; thoughts become real things. So beware when you desire, because all desires are fulfilled – sooner or later.If you are of the habit of watching the birds fly in the sky and wonder, ”How free the birds are, I wish I were a bird.” it will not be long before you become a bird. You see dogs mating, and if that moment a thought arises in you, ”What freedom! What happiness!” – soon you will become a dog. Whatever desire you keep within you, it becomes a seed.
author: Osho, Bliss: Living beyond happiness and misery

quote: Has it ever occurred to you that the last thought before your falling asleep at night becomes the first thought on waking up in the morning? All night long, while you remain asleep, the thought stays within you in a seed form. And so, that which is the last thing at night becomes first in the morning. At the moment of your death all your desires will come together and become a seed. That very seed will consequently be the new life in the womb. You start fresh from where you left off.Whatsoever you are is of your own making. Don’t blame others. As a matter of fact, there is no one whom you can blame. Basically it is the cumulative effect of your own actions. Whatsoever you are – beautiful or ugly, happy or unhappy, man or a woman – it is all a result of your actions. You are the architect of your life. Don’t blame on your stars – you’ll be simply fooling yourself. This way you are dumping the responsibility on to someone else.No need to say God has sent you – don’t dump the responsibility on God. That’s just a strategy to avoid your own responsibility. You alone are the cause for being imprisoned in this body. One who understands perfectly that he himself is responsible for being in this world, a transformation takes place in his life.
author: Osho, Bliss: Living beyond happiness and misery
category: action, life, power-of-thoughts, responsibilty, shiva-sutra, thoughts, way-to-moksha

quote: Thinking about what's beyond thought, is opening up your mind to tap into infinite intelligence designed to expand your consciousness.
author: Dr. Jacinta Mpalyenkana, Ph.D, MBA

quote: You own your feelings. You own your thoughts. You control both. No one has the right to any of it—to any of you without your permission.
author: Carlos Wallace, The Other 99 T.Y.M.E.S: Train Your Mind to Enjoy Serenity
category: carlos-wallace, controlling-your-emotions, feelings, feelings-and-emotions, feelings-emotions, feelings-of-love, feelings-quote, thoughts, thoughts-of-the-mind

quote: She rebuked herself for this thought. /she was, she saw, always having thoughts for which she rebuked herself. It then flashed across her mind that the thoughts for which she rebuked herself selfom turned out to be other than shrewd and fruitful thoughts nand she rebuked herself for this as well.
author: Patrick Hamilton, The Slaves of Solitude

quote: I have layer upon layer of thoughts in my head and the bottom one has nothing to grip on to.
author: Hanne Ørstavik, Like sant som jeg er virkelig

quote: There is not, perhaps, a more painful exercise of the mind than that of treading, with weary and impatient pace, the entire round of thought, and arriving at the same conclusion for ever; then setting out again with increased speed and diminished strength, and again returning to the very same spot - of sending all our faculties on a voyage to discover, and seeing them all return empty, and watch the wrecks as they drift helplessly along, and sink before the eye that hailed their outward expedition with joy and confidence.
author: Charles Maturin, Melmoth the Wanderer: A Tale; Vol. III

quote: People don't want to listen to their thoughts, so they fill the world with noise.
author: Erin Entrada Kelly, Hello, Universe

quote: In a moment everything could suddenly change, but God and His promises remain the same.
author: Marie Moreton, Full and Overflowing: Poems, Thoughts and Photographs Inspired by God's Creation

quote: Are my own thoughts bad?
author: K. Weikel, Hiding Behind A Mask

quote: If we occupy our minds with self-loathing or negative thoughts, then maybe we don’t have enough to do.
author: Ron Baratono, The Writings of Ron Baratono

quote: Similar to a how a flower grows incrementally, people also blossom in stages. As we age, we expand our knowledge of how the world works and how other people respond to our deeds. We also expand our language skills in order to communicate both our thoughts and feelings.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: communication, communication-skills, emotions, feelings, feelings-and-emotions, personal-development, stages-of-growth, stages-of-life, thoughts, thoughts-of-our-soul, thoughts-of-the-mind, thoughts-on-life, thoughts-quotes

quote: In the wind that ruffles through the treesI can find thoughts of you whispering to me
author: Richard L.  Ratliff
category: find, lovers, memories, romance, romantic, thoughts, trees, whispering, wind

quote: All overt and covert emotions would shrivel without the beam of contrast and comparison to supply context and implication. We need the value of counterpoise to recognize and distinguish between similar and dissimilar concepts. How do we identify the importance of hope if we never felt despair? How do we appreciate the value of society and companionship until we experience solitude and loneliness? What would any relationship be unless draped with the boughs of thoughts and feelings, without the ongoing interaction between conscientious action and unreserved devotion, without endless empathy fused with boundless love? In the ring of time, without the verve supplied by both the real and the imaginary, life would be bland, insipid, and lackluster.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: comparison, context, contextualization, contrast, counterpart, counterpoise, emotions, feelings, feelings-and-emotions, feelings-and-perceptions, implication, philosophy, philosophy-of-life, thoughts, thoughts-of-the-mind, thoughts-on-life, thoughts-quotes

quote: The hearts of everyone, the feeling is different Everyone in this world, the behavior is different The eyes are all the same.. But everyone's view is different.
author: Sachin sawariya

quote: His brain was in one of those states that are both violent and yet frighteningly calm, in which thought runs so deep it blots out reality. You no longer see the objects around you, yet you can see the shapes in your mind as thought they are outside your body.
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

quote: What does not engage our feelings does not long engage our thoughts either.
author: Lou Andreas-Salomé

quote: How come if people keep telling me I'm so smart, I keep doing such stupid things?
author: George Watsky, How to Ruin Everything Deluxe: Essays
category: george-watsky, how-to-ruin-everything, smart, thoughts, witty, youtuber

quote: Becoming the opponent means you should put yourself in an opponent's place and think from the opponent's point of view.
author: Miyamoto Musashi, The Book of Five Rings
category: culture, fighting, opponent, point-of-view, samurai, survival, thinking, thoughts

quote: You can only manage your thoughts, not your emotions. What are the emotions you're experiencing right now? What are the associated thoughts? Can you alter your thoughts? Practice! It's possible...
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership

quote: I am trying to ignore each of my thoughts and each of my stories and books... if I read them... they never sound well, but still we shouldn't go like...to do everything perfect and all perfect...
author: Deyth Banger, All As None and More

quote: I was frightened of myself, I seemed to have no control over my thoughts and feelings, it was like a sort of madness...
author: Susan Hill, Mrs de Winter

quote: Another way to strengthen connection to intuition is to refuse to allow anyone to repress your vivid energies... that means your opinions, your thoughts, your ideas, your values, your morals, your ideals. There is very little right/wrong or good/bad in this world. There is, however, use and not useful.
author: Clarissa Pinkola Estés
category: energy, good-bad, ideals, ideas, intuition, morals, opinions, right-wrong, thoughts, useful-not-useful, values

quote: Every emotion that we experience on a moment-by-moment basis has origin. The origin is a thought (s).
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership

quote: Altering our distressing emotions is an uphill battle. When you experience undesirable emotional outburst, try to alter the thought behind.
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership

quote: I think we would all agree that people should not be jailed for thoughts. But when, if ever, does a thought cross the line and become a crime?
author: Gil Valle, Raw Deal: The Untold Story Of NYPD's "Cannibal Cop"
category: cannibal-cop, crimes, crossing-the-line, gil-valle, nypd, raw-deal, thought-crimes, thoughts

quote: We develop our whole character from our thoughts, actions, attentive observations, and from the resolute pursuit of our inspirational dreams.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: behavior, character, character-development, observation, personal-beliefs, personal-thoughts, resolute, self-determination, thoughts

quote: She’s a sickness in my head.”Then get well.What you feel is self-made and attended to over time. You want to let go but are unwilling to let go because you are getting something from it; An escape? An excuse? Bondage?You are idealizing another person, building up the idea of them, and making them a legend in your own mind.Is it really a sickness or something you can control?The question is: do you even want to?Each time a thought creeps into your mind, you choose whether to give it freedom to remain or to wander. You can rebuke it or replace it. After all, it’s your mind.
author: Donna Lynn Hope

quote: The winter came with blossoms and the bees left their hive,The love was ephemeral when he became the prince charming,And the unbalanced promises couldn't take their stake
author: J. Sarraf

quote: I want to see, to know, to have, to be.
author: Mary Ann Venancio

quote: Keeping possibilities alive requires a consistency of thought and focus.
author: Steven Redhead, Life Is A Cocktail

quote: The idea of one's normality is delusional fact of the reality.
author: J. Limbu
category: dark-humor, dark-quotes, lesson, life, love, thoughts

quote: Memories tell me who I was, not who I’ll become. They don’t fix the present any more than they fix the past.
author: Caroline George, The Vestige
category: identity, memories, moments, move-on, past, present, science-fiction, thoughts

quote: Integration arises from intimacy with our emotions and our bodies, as well as with our thoughts.
author: Sharon Salzberg, Real Love: The Art of Mindful Connection

quote: Solve your problems or your problems solve you.
author: Mario Fingarov

quote: Some situations feel worst in our life, but they are the best lessons for life.
author: Saga Valsalan

quote: Clear out your thoughts, don't believe everything you think,it might be a trap within
author: Napz Cherub Pellazo
category: believe, everything, mind-over-matter, think-twice, thoughts, trap

quote: In time things thought impossible can be achieved.
author: Steven Redhead, Life Is A Cocktail

quote: For a moment Carl tried to picture everything in his mind, and then it happened. Somewhere inside of him, where cause and effect were not weighted against each other, and where logic and explanations never challenged consciousness, in that place where thoughts could live freely and played out against each other - right there in that spot, things fell into place, and he understood how it all fitted together
author: Jussi Adler-Olsen, The Keeper of Lost Causes

quote: There are things we cannot vocalise because the repercussions of particular thoughts have the power to break lives.
author: F.K. Preston

quote: I don't know how this can be but it can: A painting is both exactly rhe same and entirely different every single time you look at it.
author: Jandy Nelson, I'll Give You the Sun

quote: Mindfulness isn't about ridding yourself of thoughts. It's more about being aware and letting those thoughts pass through you, so you can see what if any value they have for you. Thoughts are an illusion but some of them are enlightening.
author: Nanette Mathews

quote: Just remember life is all an illusion.....it's your creation and you can dismantle it and re-create at will.
author: Nanette Mathews
category: create-your-life, create-your-reality, create-your-world, creation, illusion, inspirational, perception, thoughts, thoughts-become-things

quote: When the time is right, life will have a meaning.When the time is right, world will be bright again.When the time is right, things will fall into place.Just remember, never regret.
author: Akash Lakhotia, World Hypnotized: Making of the Fuhrer
category: past, regret, regret-quotes, regrets, right-time, right-time-quotes, thought, thought-on-life, thoughts, time, time-quotes

quote: Every bonsaidreams of being a tall tree - until the wind blows
author: Don Barnard

quote: He is quick witted, yes! Astute big time & level headed in opinion. It is my firsthand judgment of a man.
author: Parul Wadhwa
category: campus, college-life, confidence-and-attitudedence, delhi-university, judgment, life-quotes-and-sayings, life-wisdom-quotes, men-quotes, the-masquerade, thoughts

quote: When our thoughts are unsettled and our inner world is in a muddle, we may sharpen our wits and try to recognize the invisible edges of our fractured stance. If we seek to figure out, what our life story is all about, we may be able to put the missing pieces in place and identify what is driving us, what we are actually up to and why we are running like mad dogs, sometimes. (“On a doggy day”)
author: Erik Pevernagie
category: actually, be-up-to-something, day, doggy, drive, edges, figure-out, fractured, identify, inner-world, invisible, life-story, mad-dogs, missing-pieces, muddle, put-in-place, recognize, run, seek, sharpen, sometimes, stance, thoughts, try, unsettled, wits

quote: ...I turned the music back on and reached to turn off my lamp, trying not to think about anything for a few minutes. That's always impossible, though. It's easier to stop breathing than it is to stop thinking.
author: Robin Benway, Emmy & Oliver

quote: I stayed in the town until early evening, and when the sun began to sink, my heart did too. This is your last chance to go back, I told myself. Once it gets completely dark, you might never be able to leave here. I went home on the same buses that had brought me there. I arrived before seven, and no one noticed that I had run away.
author: Haruki Murakami, The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle

quote: I stayed in the town until earlyevening, and when the sun began to sink, my heart did too. This is your last chance to goback, I told myself. Once it gets completely dark, you might never be able to leave here. Iwent home on the same buses that had brought me there. I arrived before seven, and no onenoticed that I had run away.
author: Haruki Murakami, The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle

quote: At least there is one book with which we all or few of us could have fun.
author: Deyth Banger, 2 Hours

quote: We inhabit an internal world that is subject to diversification. Every day we undergo personal transformation based upon experiences, thoughts, and feelings.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: experiences, feelings, introspection, personal-change, personal-development, personal-growth, personal-growth-quotes, personal-transformation, thoughts

quote: I am afraid to die, though,' I whispered to myself. These turned out to be my last words. They were not very impressive words, but it was too late to change them.
author: Haruki Murakami, The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle

quote: A person must move beyond guilt and unexamined thoughts and motives in order to discover a purpose for living vibrantly.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: guilt, meaningful-life, mindset, mindset-quotes, purpose-driven-life, purposeful-living, self-determination, self-development, self-examination, thoughts

quote: Suddenly, as Avis clung to her father’s neck and ear while, with a casual arm, the man enveloped his lumpy and large offspring, I saw Lolita’s smile lose all its light and become a frozen little shadow of itself, and the fruit knife slipped off the table and struck her with its silver handle a freak blow on the ankle which made her gasp, and crouch head forward, and then, jumping on one leg, her face awful with the preparatory grimace which children hold till the tears gush, she was gone — to be followed at once and consoled in the kitchen by Avis who had such a wonderful fat pink dad and a small chubby brother, and a brand-new baby sister, and a home, and two grinning dogs, and Lolita had nothing.
author: Vladimir Nabokov, Lolita

quote: Life tends to deliver on what we order…so when you think I’m worthless, you get a life fitting what thought. When you think I’m fabulous…you get that.
author: Toni Sorenson, The Great Brain Cleanse

quote: This had been happening more and more often: the two of us come upon each other by accident in the early hours of the morning and take solace in each others' company, weathering out the peril of being awake at this time of night, when thoughts that are neatly ordered or justly murdered during the day come loose from their moorings and out of their graves, to tie themselves to each other in new and dangerous ways.
author: Dexter Palmer, The Dream of Perpetual Motion
category: dexter-palmer, early-morning, figurative-language, late-nights, metaphor, personification, the-dream-of-perpetual-motion, thoughts

quote: And the cavern of fire was enormous, labyrinthine, that received the man. He branched and flamed, glowed and increased, and was suddenly extinguished in the little puffs of smoke and tired thoughts.
author: Patrick White, The Tree Of Man

quote: What a tremendous sin impatience is, he thinks. It blinds us to the moment before us, and it is only when that moment has passed that we look back, and see it was full of treasures.
author: Robert Jackson Bennett, City of Miracles

quote: Life is a series of puzzles
author: all you have to do is solve the puzzles.
category: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People

quote: Always think in terms of solutions. Focusing on the problems usually gives us more of them.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People

quote: Nothing worth anything has ever proven itself to be easy. I should think you 'd have discovered this by now.
author: Aria Beth Sloss, Autobiography of Us

quote: Where you are now is the result of your previous overriding thoughts and actions. Tomorrow is still in the making so plant good seeds...
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People
category: actions, behaviours, goals, planting-a-seed, sowing-and-reaping, thoughts, tomorrow-is-in-the-making

quote: It isn't an easy business (...) Love, he said finally. I was referring to love, Rebecca.
author: Aria Beth Sloss, Autobiography of Us

quote: Think out of the box but stay in the yard.
author: Johnnie Dent Jr.
category: goal-setting, goal-setting-quotes, risk-taking-quotes, think-outside-the-box, thinking, thoughts

quote: Modern day information overload stops us sufficiently engaging with our thoughts.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People

quote: It takes effort and concern to really think about things.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People
category: concern, effort, introspection, reflection, think, thoughts

quote: Either I shall find it, or I shall not find it. I examine my note-case. I look in all my pockets. These are the things that forever interrupt the process upon which I am eternally engaged of finding some perfect phrase that fits this moment exactly.
author: Virginia Woolf, The Waves

quote: The character, therefore, will depend upon the thoughts. I am what I think. I am what I think even more than what I do, for it is the thought that interprets the action. An act in itself good may become even bad by the thought that inspired it.
author: Basil W. Maturin, Self-Knowledge and Self-Discipline

quote: What we do makes a difference and what we think about influences what we do.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People

quote: Does someone else care as much about you as I do?
author: Maite

quote: Get in the driving seat of your thoughts. You control them and they absolutely control your life.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People

quote: Our brains are like computers; it's our responsibility to programme them well, daily, and remove the viruses.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People

quote: I know very little with anything approaching certainty. I know that I was born, that I exist, and that I will die. For the most part, I can trust my brain's interpretation of the data presented to my senses: this is a rose, that is a car, she is my wife. I do not doubt the reality of the thoughts and emotions and impulses I experience in response to these things. . . . Yet apart from these primary perceptions, intuitions, inferences, and bits of information, the views that I hold about the things that really matter to me--meaning, truth, happiness, goodness, beauty--are finely woven tissues of belief and opinion.
author: Stephen Batchelor, Confession of a Buddhist Atheist

quote: Via self-talk we give our mind instructions on what we expect of ourselves and so behave accordingly. Change the instructions and we change the outcomes.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People
category: behaviour, instructions, mind-programming, outcomes, self-talk, thoughts

quote: Our emotions stem from our thoughts, redirect your thoughts to redirect your emotions.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People

quote: Identifying body language changes connected with the conversation in hand gives us insights into their thoughts and emotions.
author: Sam Owen, 500 Relationships And Life Quotes: Bite-Sized Advice For Busy People

quote: The evil and negative thoughts are the time bomb. Whenever that reaches its time, it goes to explode, damaging others, and even yourself. Defuse that, with your best, and positive thoughts, before it explodes.
author: Ehsan Sehgal

quote: I have to remind myself that I've always known this: Evolution is not for everybody.
author: Daniel Pinkwater

quote: Summer quiet thoughts on summer quiet noons.
author: Ray Bradbury, Now and Forever

quote: She has the most delicious thoughts about you, Tamlin,” he said. “She’s wondered about the feeling of your fingers on her thighs—between them, too.” He chuckled. Even as he said my most private thoughts, even as I burned with outrage and shame, I trembled at the grip still on my mind. Rhysand turned to the High Lord. “I’m curious: Why did she wonder if it would feel good to have you bite her breast the way you bit her neck?” “Let. Her. Go.” Tamlin’s face was twisted with such feral rage that it struck a different, deeper chord of terror in me. “If it’s any consolation,” Rhysand confided to him, “she would have been the one for you—and you might have gotten away with it. A bit late, though. She’s more stubborn than you are.
author: Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Thorns and Roses
category: feyre, high-lord, intimate, let-her-go, mad, rage, read-minds, rhysand, tamlin, thoughts

quote: Some people are pragmatists, taking things as they come and making the best of the choices available. Some people are idealists, standing for principle and refusing to compromise. And some people just act on any whim that enters their heads. I wonder which one YOU are. I pragmatically turn my whims into principles!
author: Bill Watterson, It's a Magical World: A Calvin and Hobbes Collection
category: ideas, pragmatist, principles, realist, spontaneity, thinking, thoughts, whimsical

quote: Osaka: Ah Get to ponderin' when Christmas rolls around. Y'all know Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer? That's messed up, y'know? Saying his nose will help light the way at night ain't no way t'make him feel better about it. If you told a bald fella you needed the light reflecting off his head to see, he'd like to punch you. Santa's a cruel bully.
author: Kiyohiko Azuma, Azumanga Daioh: The Omnibus
category: christmas, idiocy, manga, osaka, random, random-thoughts, rudolph-the-red-nosed-reindeer, thinking, thoughts

quote: Some' strong decisions stamp you as 'rude'. But in future, they will realize that you were right. But be cautious about the 'Some'.
author: Saga Valsalan

quote: The world outside the window is beautiful only if you try to find beauty in those what you see
author: Saga Valsalan

quote: You don’t create your thoughts, but you choose your thoughts. To pick the right thoughts at a right time is what wisdom is all about.
author: Roshan Sharma
category: feelings, insight, mindfulness, thinking, thoughts, wisdom

quote: The world around you know only that reflects on you, that is the success of a joker too.
author: Saga Valsalan

quote: First you will suffer, then you will tolerate and finally you will accept all your pain. Life will be always like this
author: Saga Valsalan

quote: Just because everyone agrees that something is true doesn't make it so; everyone was in accord for thousands of years, saying the world was flat, the sun revolved around the earth, but everyone was wrong.
author: Aaron Dennis

quote: Life’s much more pleasing when you don’t have to spend all of your time thinking.
author: David Eddings, Crystal Gorge
category: happiness, life, philosophy, pleasure, simplicity, thoughts

quote: There is a difference between perspective and perception. Perspective is a personal idea about certain events, based on the impressions, experiences or information available to the mind, while the perception is a momentary thought about the situation, event or people, purely based on the past experience or impressions.
author: Roshan Sharma
category: beliefs, experience, ideas, impressions, perception, perspective, thoughts

quote: Amanda had way too much time to think being at the hospital without any friends. She didn’t want to dwell on her thoughts for too long lest the wrong ones might emerge. She was hoping to forget what happened to her.
author: Jason Medina, No Hope for the Hopeless at Kings Park
category: adolescent-unit, amanda, building-122, forget, group-2, jason-medina, kings-park, kings-park-psychiatric-center, kings-park-state-hospital, kppc, kpsh, memories, mental-illness, thoughts

quote: When we don't automatically take them (thoughts) personally or believe the stories about "reality" that we build from them,when we can simply hold them in awareness with a sense of curiosity and wonder at their amazing power given their insubstantiality, their limitations,and inaccuracies,then we have a chance right in that moment,in any moment really,to not get caught in their habitual patterning,to see thoughts for what they are,impersonal events.Then in that moment at least, we are already free,ready to act with greater clarity and kindness within the constantly changing field of events that is nothing other than life unfolding-- not always as we think it should,but definitely as it is.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn, Mindfulness for Beginners

quote: The novice spends too much time worrying about what you get.It is all about hoarding.Things.Thoughts.Worries.Appraisals.Love.You name it .
author: Kaleb Kilton

quote: The fact that has got to be faced is that to abolish class-distinctions means abolishing a part of yourself. Here am I, a typical member of the middle class. It is easy for me to say that I want to get rid of class-distinctions, but nearly everything I think and do is a result of class-distinctions. All my notions — notions of good and evil, of pleasant and unpleasant, of funny and serious, of ugly and beautiful — are essentially middle-class notions; my taste in books and food and clothes, my sense of honour, my table manners, my turns of speech, my accent, even the characteristic movements of my body, are the products of a special kind of upbringing and a special niche about half-way up the social hierarchy.
author: George Orwell, The Road to Wigan Pier

quote: The healthiest way I know how to move through an emotion effectively is to surrender completely to that emotion when its loop of physiology comes over me. I simply resign to the loop and let it run its course for 90 seconds. Just like children, emotions heal when they are heard and validated. Over time, the intensity and frequency of these circuits usually abate. ...Paying attention to which array of circuits we are concurrently running provides us with tremendous insight into how our minds are fundamentally wired...
author: Jill Bolte Taylor, My Stroke of Insight: A Brain Scientist's Personal Journey

quote: A little difficult to know where you were with Elinor. She didn't reveal much of what she thought and felt about things. He liked that about her. He hated people who reeled off their thoughts and feelings to you, who took it for granted that you wanted to know all their mechanism. Reserve was always more interesting.
author: Agatha Christie, Sad Cypress

quote: Let my notes, like the most sensitive seismograph, record the curve of even the most insignificant vibrations of my brain: for it is precisely such vibrations that are sometimes the forewarning of...
author: Yevgeny Zamyatin, We

quote: The emotions must be called upon to give feeling to the thought so it will take form. - Charless Haanel P.g29
author: Rhonda Byrne, The Power

quote: Ram-fication of Ravan-ous thoughts is what Dussehra all about.
author: Vikrmn, Corpkshetra
category: ca-vikram-verma, chartered-accountant, corpkshetra, dushehra, dussehra, inspirational, motivational, ram, ravan, thoughts, vikram, vikram-verma, vikrmn, vv

quote: I was overlooking the heights and I felt somewhere in between!
author: Jasleen Kaur Gumber
category: emotions, feelings, height, identity, life, mountains, thoughts

quote: You're allowed to have thoughts, she reminded herself. Just because others might scoff, that doesn't mean you won't anymore.
author: Lauren Myracle

quote: I feel rather a fool writing down my thoughts
author: Ellen Emerson White, Voyage on the Great Titanic: The Diary of Margaret Ann Brady, R.M.S. Titanic, 1912

quote: People say home is where the heart is, but I think maybe home is the heart
author: David Arnold, Mosquitoland

quote: You are not a real thinker if your thoughts haven't landed you in trouble yet
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana, Pearls Of Eternity
category: dying-for-your-beliefs, freedom-of-speech, philosophy, philosophy-quotes, reason, reasoning, reasons-why, think, thinker, thinkers, thinkers-of-our-time, thinking, thinking-quotes, thinking-with-a-great-mind, thought, thought-process, thought-processing, thoughts, thoughts-for-life, thoughts-of-the-mind, thoughts-on-life, thoughts-quotes

quote: Be my bedtime story and the thoughts that won't let me fall asleep. Be the conversation that I always have in my head at 3 AM and that beautiful voice that never lets me sleep.
author: Akshay Vasu
category: 3am, asleep, beautiful, bedtime, conversation, fall, head, story, thoughts, voice

quote: When a friend suddenly comes to mind for no apparent reason, he said it’s because they are near to us in thought or spirit. He explained that a connection takes place on the thought waves that run between us. Thoughts are things that can reach out and touch us.
author: Kate McGahan, The Lizard from Rainbow Bridge: A True Tale of an Unexpected Angel
category: connection, friend, manifest, spirit, things, thoughts

quote: An attitude is much deeper than just our emotions or the thoughts we think. It’s a decision we make based on our core beliefs and values.
author: Toni Sorenson, Aligned By Christ
category: attitude, beliefs, inspiration, life, thoughts, values

quote: All that glisters is not gold;Often have you heard that told.Many a man his life hath soldBut my outside to behold - Gilded tombs do worms infold;Had you been as wise as bold,Young in limbs, in judgement old,Your answer had not been inscrolled - Fare you well; your suit is cold.
author: William Skakespeare

quote: Bees will not work except in darkness
author: Thought will not work except in Silence
category: neither will Virtue Work except in secrecy.

quote: Honesty requires that we communicate our thoughts and feelings, not our conclusions.
author: Stefan Molyneux, Real-Time Relationships: The Logic of Love

quote: All of our thoughts – ideas – are traceable to a sensation, an encounter with the world that leaves an impression upon the mind.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: ideas, mindfulness, personal-experience, reality-of-life, sensation, thinking, thinking-quotes, thoughts

quote: …of constipation of the brain & diarrhea of the mouth.
author: Jack Kerouac, Scattered Poems

quote: I keep quiet and look out the window. The light is weak and watery-looking, like the sun hast just spilled itself over the horizon and is too lazy to clean itself up. The shadows are as sharp and pointed as needles. I watch three black crows take off simultaneausly from a telephone wire and wish I could take off too, move up, up, up, and watch the ground drop away from me the way it does when you're on an airplane, folding and compressing into itself like an origami figure, until everything is flat and brightly colored - until the world is like a drawing of itself
author: Lauren Oliver, Before I Fall

quote: Self-reflection is a kind of self-judgment. The difference is just this – the former is positive and the latter is negative.
author: Balroop Singh

quote: You need to work on your attitude if you are experiencing the hatred. Because it is you yourself thinking about it
author: Bikash Bhandari
category: attitude, avoid-hatred, experience, hatred, power-of-thoughts, thoughts

quote: Your thoughts are based on your perceptions and those thoughts are capable to refine your perceptions again.
author: Bikash Bhandari
category: mindfulness, mindset, perceive, perceptions, thoughtfulness, thoughts

quote: For the philosopher, language, thought, and passion are the same. Ideas are personal to a philosopher; they express their human passion and articulate their novel ideas in language. Ideas are more than mere concepts, trifles that the philosophical mind toys with. Ideas provide both the structure and inner vitality that holds great thinkers’ conceptual structure together.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: idealist, ideas, ideas-quotes, language, philosophers, philosophical-musings, philosophy, philosophy-quotes, thoughts, thoughts-on-life, writers, writing-life, writing-quotes

quote: All action results from thought, so it is thoughts that matter.
author: Sai Baba

quote: Every hour, stop and ask: Am I really present in this moment? If not, what are my thoughts focused on? Doing this often will help you return to the present moment.
author: Azim Jamal & Brian Tracy, What You Seek Is Seeking You
category: hour, moment, present, present-moment, return, thoughts

quote: Because, he says, it hurts to think about things that you can't have or help. S'better not to think about it.
author: Rainbow Rowell, Carry On

quote: I love the sound of people thinking.
author: Will Bly, Creatures: A Collection of Short Stories

quote: If my phrases shock the reader, that only shows it is high time he or she was shocked.
author: H.G. Wells, You Can't Be Too Careful

quote: What we believe is a matter of choice provided we have control over our thoughts. It’s no less than living in bliss with each passing moment when you can see your thoughts flowing in apt directions.
author: Taranpreet Singh

quote: Thoughts which are mixed with any of the feelings of emotions, constitute a "magnetic" force which attracts other similar, or related thoughts.
author: Napoleon Hill, Think and Grow Rich

quote: I seemed to be the only person I knew without a plan that would put the world on its feet and wipe the tear from every eye. No wonder I felt like a stranger in my own land.
author: Robertson Davies, Fifth Business

quote: Sometimes, some of times in life are Lifetime!
author: Jasleen Kaur Gumber
category: abstract, life, lifetime, meaning, realisation, thinking, thoughts, time, truth

quote: We are all same, inside our homes!
author: Jasleen Kaur Gumber
category: differences, home, homes, humans, life, psychology, similarity, thinking, thoughts

quote: More often than not- Life moves really fast! It's only for you to pause and breathe! Sadly, none else can do that for you!
author: Jasleen Kaur Gumber
category: deep, fast, identity, life, musings, pause, philosophy, stop, thoughts, time, you

quote: I was contemplating on why I wanted to share this with you, can you handle it, can you handle me being blunt, will you just judge me for revealing how I may feel towards a person, topic or even you, so with all that being said... I wasn't going to show this but I feel like a collection of people need to hear it, and also profusion of weak-minded individuals are scared to say the truth amongst the masses (which are their friends, strangers, and family members); the reason why they might be hesitant on sharing their thoughts on a "strange topic" may consist of fear of being judged, fear of being an outcast, being alone, failing your loved ones, staying in a box, remaining in the hands of poor choices of leaders, fitting into this category of "weirdos", and/or being placed in a barrel of deep-dark-matter, forming strange thoughts of abnormal voices and situations regarding inscrutable singleton/misfits. You tried comparing being cynical, introverted, using meaningless words of misfits, with being insane, psychotic, mentally deranged and "strange-minded" Really? if being motivated to be the very best of your abilities will take you, not knowing your own limits, never stopping until you have nothing left in your body and even then, you won't stop because you know, if you stop you may miss something significant, so then guess what; I assume I am a psychotic, deranged, mentally disturbed, insane, and strange-minded individual. but anyways, off topic, I'm always drawn towards the obscure, darker, deep-mined and vague individuals because I think it's just a lot more interesting. But it's also thought-provoking fun doing the meaningless antics sometimes, and I think that's why 'Misfits' have been great in that way, as you get a really good balance of unusual, obscured, introverted, thinks-loudly, randomness, provocative (in the way of, not caring what you may think of them, but keeping that mentality of self-respect and of others in mind), refreshing, and amusing. I will never understand the course of thought behind apotheosizing a person not knowing who they really are, it's strange, but whatever do you.Extra stuff:Like I said before, I honestly can care less what people have to tell me what I need to do in order to keep my sanity, composure, and how I may feel at this point in my life; but just know, I am in no way shape or form, saying everything that's happening in the world or in my life is all for a greater purpose, I'm simply saying, poor choices are a part of life, and if this is one of mine then so be it, I'll accept it as a learning experience, so peace out. PS: I am not directing this to anyone, in particular, it is just a series's concept, with underground meanings.
author: Judah Siler

quote: I know what you might be thinking here on your own, but those thoughts won’t last for ever,’ I said. ‘You won’t always feel like this. This will pass. Homer will be here for you, and the sun will rise and you’ll find your reasons again. The ones you think have deserted you. Isn’t that right, Meg?
author: Sarah Moore Fitzgerald, The Apple Tart of Hope

quote: Even the brightest stars burn out eventually.
author: Trevor Driggers

quote: Wittgenstein likes to assert: "Whereof we cannot speak we must be silent". But skilfully using our hands and manipulating our thoughts can be plausible options to make ourselves understood. So, if we can’t say it, we can show and depict it. Whereof we cannot speak we can paint! ("Happy days are back again")
author: Erik Pevernagie
category: assert, depict, hands, happy-days, like, manipulate, options, paint, plausible, show, silent, skilfully, speak, thoughts, understood, use, wittgenstein

quote: Have you ever felt so full of thoughts you think you could burst?
author: Anyta Sunday, rock

quote: Every time I am in the dark and a bit of light falls on me, I see a bit of you in my shadows. There is always a bit of you in every song I hear, in every thought I conceive, in every rain that I drench in, in every star that I stare at in the sky every night and in every breeze that touches me.
author: Akshay Vasu
category: breeze, dark, love, memories, miss, night, rain, shadow, thoughts, touch

quote: Choose thoughts like how you choose your friends, only the right one's.
author: Wordions

quote: Faith without action is delusion. Faith does not wait for miracles but produces them. If you think you can or if you think you can't, you are right.
author: Henry Ford
category: achievement, action, delusion, faith, goals, hard-work, thoughts, work-hard

quote: What’s emerging from the pattern of my own life is the for belief that the crisis is being caused by the inadequacy of existing forms of thought to cope with the situation. It can’t be solved by rational means because the rationality itself is the source of the problem. The only ones who’re solving it are solving it at a personal level by abandoning ‘square’ rationality altogether and going by feelings alone. Like John and Sylvia here. And millions of others like them. And that seems like a wrong direction too. So I guess what I’m trying to say is that the solution to the problem isn’t that you abandon rationality but that you expand the nature of rationality so that it’s capable of coming up with a solution.
author: Robert M. Pirsig, Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values
category: feelings, modern-problems, philosophy, rational, solutions, thinking, thoughts

quote: If you're an open book I would've carefully read through the pages you've written with your life so far, so I would know where you are at right now.
author: Mei Jancorda

quote: Becoming sensitive to the background causes of one's thoughts and feelings can—paradoxically—allow for greater creative control over one's life. It is one thing to bicker with your wife because you are in a bad mood; it is another to realize that your mood and behavior have been caused by low blood sugar. This understanding reveals you to be a biochemical puppet, of course, but it also allows you to grab hold of one of your strings: A bit of food may be all that your personality requires. Getting behind our concious thoughts and feelings can allow us to steer a more intelligent course through our lives (while knowing, of course, that we are ultimately being steered).
author: Sam Harris, Free Will

quote: Your perspective guides your thoughts, your choices, your trajectory.
author: James Thornton
category: beliefs, choices, direction-in-life, perspective, thoughts, truth

quote: Within the madness of my subliminal mind often brilliant thoughts are aligned.
author: Stanley Victor Paskavich

quote: My thoughts were interrupted when I heard someone got slapped. By the sound alone, one could tell that it was a hard one. I figured whoever got slapped had to be close by, so I spun around in search of this person who had just gotten the daylights slapped out of them, only to discover that the person was me.
author: Drexel Deal, The Fight of My Life is Wrapped Up in My Father
category: assaulted, disbelief, fight, in-shock, insulted, interrupted, mistaking, slapped, surprised, thoughts

quote: Deep down inside what i want is a little of me.
author: Lucas Soares Adriano

quote: Space between thoughts is the meditative silence where greatness is created.” - Anishka - Songs of the Mist
author: Shashi, Songs of the Mist

quote: Say thank you for a beautiful life and be grateful for the small things of life which are miracles we have actually got used to. Gratitude banishes negativity from your life, brings happiness and you start living in abundance and attract more love and prosperity because of the way you think about your life.
author: Sanchita Pandey, Voyage to Happiness!
category: abundance, attraction, gratitude, happiness, happy-life, love, prosperity, thinking, thoughts

quote: If your strengths don't, then your weakness's will soon define you.
author: Sachin Kumar Puli
category: energy, healing, stay-strong, stay-strong-and-positive, thought-provoking, thoughts

quote: It was his power, his gift, suddenly to shed all superfluities, to shrink and diminish so that he looked barer and felt sparer, even physically, yet lost none of his intensity of mind, and so to stand on his little ledge facing the dark of human ignorance, how we know nothing and the sea eats away the ground we stand on - that was his fate, his gift. But having thrown away, when he dismounted, all gestures and fripperies, all trophies of nuts and roses, and shrunk so that not only fame but even his own name was forgotten by him, he kept even in that desolation a vigilance which spared no phantom and luxuriated in no vision, and it was in this guise that he inspired in William Bankes (intermittently) and in Charles Tansley (obsequiously) and in his wife now, when she looked up and saw him standing at the edge of the lawn, profoundly, reverence, and pity, and gratitude too, as a stake driven into the bed of a channel upon which the gulls perch and the waves beat inspires in merry boat-loads a feeling of gratitude for the duty it is taking upon itself of marking the channel out there in the floods alone.
author: Virginia Woolf, To the Lighthouse

quote: You could see her thoughts swimming around in her eyes, like fish - some bright, some dark, some fast, quick, some slow and easy, and sometimes, like when she looked up where Earth was, being nothing but colour and nothing else.
author: Ray Bradbury, The Martian Chronicles

quote: Some of your most powerful intentions are born in your moments of greatest contrast.
author: Michael Thomas Sunnarborg, The White Box Club Handbook: Simple Tools For Career Transition

quote: Shrink wrapped ideas and prefabricated thoughts are a result of sloth and laziness. ("Prêt-à-penser")
author: Erik Pevernagie
category: ideas, laziness, prefabricated, prêt-a-penser, result, shrink-wrap, sloth, thoughts

quote: At this moment, in this place, the shifting action potential in my neurons cascade into certain arrangements, patterns, thoughts; they flow down my spine, branch into my arms, my fingers, until muscles twitch and thought is translated into motion; mechanical levers are pressed; electrons are rearranged; marks are made on paper.At another time, in another place, light strikes the marks, reflects into a pair of high-precision optical instruments sculpted by nature after billions of years of random mutations; upside-down images are formed against two screens made up of millions of light-sensitive cells, which translate light into electrical pulses that go up the optic nerves, cross the chiasm, down the optic tracts, and into the visual cortex, where the pulses are reassembled into letters, punctuation marks, words, sentences, vehicles, tenors, thoughts.The entire system seems fragile, preposterous, science fictional.
author: Ken Liu, The Paper Menagerie and Other Stories
category: flow, fragile, neurons, patterns, science-fiction, system, thoughts, translation

quote: Well, what shall I say; our inward thoughts, do they ever show outwardly? There may be a great fire in our soul, but no one ever comes to warm himself at it, and the passers-by see only a little bit of smoke coming through the chimney, and pass on their way.
author: Vincent van Gogh, The Letters of Vincent van Gogh

quote: In a room with many windowssome thoughts slide past uncatchable, ghostly.
author: Jane Hirshfield, The Beauty: Poems

quote: Having unthoughtful thoughts for me is unthinkable, so much so that I cannot even think about that.
author: Ana Claudia Antunes
category: thinking-outside-of-the-box, thinking-outside-the-box, thinking-positive, thinking-quotes, thinking-with-a-great-mind, thought, thought-provoking, thoughtful, thoughts, unthinkable, unthought

quote: I am a diamond But people see me as goldHonestly, I wanna be silver
author: M

quote: A brainstorm about the difference between rain and brain: a b, although both are juicy like water... but if it rained in the brain would that mean that ocurred a brainwash? and if so what would be the cure for that?? That's rough for sure. But if the rain plays mainly in the land would it land instead of fail to fall?? What's the meaning of it all? i'm a brainiac with some brainy thoughts..
author: Ana Claudia Antunes
category: brain, brainiac, brainstorm, brainstorming, brainwashing, brainy, brainy-quote, land, rain, raining, thinking, thought-provoking, thoughts, thoughts-of-the-mind

quote: Mind over matter represents the triumph of will over physical hindrance. Our thoughts are our weapon against the world.
author: David Adam, The Man Who Couldn't Stop

quote: Thoughts like weeds will grow automatically unless we train them according to our choice. Thoughts gravitate according to what’s happening around us.
author: Hina Hashmi, Your Life A Practical Guide to Happiness Peace and Fulfilment

quote: Your thoughts exist. Whatever you have thought today, yesterday or many years back, it is energy and it exists. Your attention activates thoughts and it is strengthened with your repetition.
author: Hina Hashmi, Your Life A Practical Guide to Happiness Peace and Fulfilment
category: attention, energy, energy-quotes, frequency, law-of-attraction, law-of-attraction-quotes, repitition, thoughts

quote: Mankind is like ocean, we only see the things which comes up! If we wanna know someone better we need a deeper dive.
author: Irfa Adam

quote: I take showers to think.
author: J.R. Rim
category: calm, clarity, clear, flow, happy, relax, shower, think, thoughts, water

quote: i have a hurricane of thoughts thatsimply evolves within me andbewilder my inner soul .
author: shivangi lavaniya

quote: implementation of thoughts is attainedby few and so is success
author: shivangi lavaniya

quote: When you are cursed with a bipolar mind racing thoughts are the ones that you find
author: Stanley Victor Paskavich, Stantasyland: Quips Quotes and Quandaries

quote: Guard your hearts and thoughts
author: it is well spring of either life or death.

quote: Quality of life does not depends up on the branded product that you use. It totally depends up on the quality of your thoughts and quality you maintain to express your thoughts
author: Anoop Raghav

quote: Isn't it strange that we talk least about the things we think about most?
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: An' I got to thinkin', on'y it wasn't thinkin', it was deeper down than thinkin'.
author: John Steinbeck, The Grapes of Wrath

quote: It is what you think it is that makes it so, and not necessarily what it really is.
author: Dr. Jacinta Mpalyenkana, Ph.D, MBA

quote: One of the greatest tragedies of our time, is this impression that has been created that science and religion have to be at war
author: Francis Collins

quote: Ego is the complete identification with form. Physical forms, thought forms, emotional forms.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: Always be aware of what you are thinking. Pay attention to your thoughts because they drive the direction of your life.
author: Toni Sorenson, The Great Brain Cleanse

quote: We’ve all got voices inside our heads and over time they blend into a mental orchestra that all sounds the same. This is where we assume every voice we hear is our own even though that is not true.
author: Toni Sorenson, The Great Brain Cleanse

quote: If our thoughts and beliefs—both conscious and unconscious—are in conflict, they will cancel each other out and nothing will manifest. So if you desire success but believe you have not earned it, you will not succeed.
author: Russell Anthony Gibbs, The Six Principles of Enlightenment and Meaning of Life

quote: He wasn’t a good person, but I painted him to be and since I painted it, I believed it.
author: Dominic Riccitello
category: bad-people, good-people, hate, life, love, overshadowing, painter, perspective, sad, sad-people, thoughts, truth

quote: I love you, but I’m more in love with myself and that’s the problem.
author: Dominic Riccitello
category: life, love, narcissism, opinion, perspective, respect, self, self-love, self-worth, thoughts, truth, worth

quote: Walking a mile in someone else's shoes isn't as much about the walk or the shoes; it's to be able to think like they think, feel what they feel, and understand why they are who and where they are. Every step is about empathy.
author: Toni Sorenson, The Great Brain Cleanse

quote: Hallucinations aren’t always out of the ordinary. How do we know we’re not hallucinating if everything seems plausible?
author: Dominic Riccitello
category: hallucinations, life, normal, ordinary, perspective, strange, thoughts, truth

quote: An idle mind doesn't do justice to its potential
author: Essa Alam

quote: The only way to make a great thought great is to share it.
author: Toni Sorenson, The Great Brain Cleanse

quote: We are designed for harmony, an ebb and flow that’s almost inconceivable it’s so flawless. So when things go wrong and our cells can’t communicate with each other, or there is miscommunication, there is a direct biological link to why we don’t think clearly, we don’t feel right, and our lives get stalled. 	It happens when a child gets abused.	It happens when a brain gets physically wounded.	It happens when fear or pain is so great it overrides everything else.	It happens during times of prolonged stress.		It happens in the throes of depression.	It happens when the brain gets pounded with negativity.	And sometimes we just don’t know why the wires in our brains get crossed.
author: Toni Sorenson, The Great Brain Cleanse

quote: When neurons “talk” to each other clearly, our brain is able to make sense of our lives. We make our wisest decisions when there is nothing obstructing these lines of communication.
author: Toni Sorenson, The Great Brain Cleanse

quote: Master yourself, your thoughts and feelings, and you master the whole universe.
author: Jeffrey Fry

quote: All truly toxic thoughts are expelled while moving. Gotta move to stay alive.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: When negative thinking changes, everything changes.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: When a person has a reaction to something in their environment, there’s a 90 second chemical process that happens in the body; after that, any remaining emotional response is just the person choosing to stay in that emotional loop.Something happens in the external world and chemicals are flushed through your body which puts it on full alert. For those chemicals to totally flush out of the body it takes less than 90 seconds.This means that for 90 seconds you can watch the process happening, you can feel it happening, and then you can watch it go away.After that, if you continue to feel fear, anger, and so on, you need to look at the thoughts that you’re thinking that are re-stimulating the circuitry that is resulting in you having this physiological response over and over again.
author: Jill Bolte Taylor

quote: Two spectrums generate our thoughts … one comes from fear and the other from love. Every emotion in between starts at one of those two places.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: Anxiety is nothing more than prolonged fear. It comes with prolonged chemical release that does incalculable damage to your neurons over time.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: Think about what you are thinking about. Be aware of your own thoughts!
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: Only when people are aware will they start to care.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: Once you are aware that you have a weak spot you can begin to strengthen it, work on it, and finally turn it into a stronghold. But nothing can happen until you become aware.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: Be aware of the voices in your head. Identify them. Just became you hear it doesn’t mean it’s your voice saying it. And just because you think it doesn’t mean it’s true.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: Be aware of the voices in your head. Identify them. Just because you hear it doesn’t mean it’s your voice saying it. And just because you think it doesn’t mean it’s true.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: You do not have to be religious to be spiritual and moral.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: Can you identify the voices inside of your own head? It’s imperative that you do so you can understand who is doing your thinking.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: You’ll never get it if you can’t see yourself having it.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: You have the ability to drive your brain and the capability to nab the steering wheel back any time you feel yourself veering off the road you intended to take.
author: Toni Sorenson
category: awareness, brain, control, life, self-control, thoughts

quote: The happiest, most successful, extraordinary people are not people who have coasted through life. They’ve fallen, they’ve been shoved; they’ve known loss and defeat. They’ve struggled out of the darkest, deepest pits and they’ve emerged with their hearts softened, their minds sharpened, and their spirits concerned for others. These are the rare beautiful people who know how to think their way to greatness. They understand that a great life begins with a great thought.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: We humans have two things that set us apart and make us able to do what no other form of life can—reason and feel. That’s because we have brains and hearts.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: The journey to the center of your soul doesn’t start in your heart. It begins in your brain, and taking it makes you among the bravest of the brave for it’s a place only the rare dare venture.
author: Toni Sorenson

quote: The thing about having it all is, it should include having the ability to have it all. Maybe there are some people who know how to have it all. They're probably off in a group somewhere, laughing at those of us who have it all but don't know how to.
author: Carrie Fisher, Postcards from the Edge

quote: Some days I don't know what is greater.My wisdom, or my stupidity.
author: Sanober  Khan
category: amusing, introspection, life-lessons, life-quotes, poet, poetry-quotes, poets, stupidity, thoughts, truth, wisdom, wise-words

quote: Cultivate your thoughts in to positive seeds and see your life change for the better!
author: Angie karan

quote: i am hopelessly in love with a momentthat has not come yetit existssomewheresome placejust not herejust not now
author: Aditya Kandari

quote: Thoughts make life tough.
author: Bharath Mamidoju

quote: Gratifying when the basics reflect a fresh light, leading to real continuing ed.
author: Phillip Gary Smith, HARMONIZING: Keys to Living in the Song of Life
category: basics, continuing-education, discovering, life-lessons, teachings, thoughts

quote: I' is nothing it just a thought..........!
author: Sushil Singh

quote: As the waves relentlessly seek the shore, so my thoughts continually return to you.
author: John Mark Green
category: love, love-quotes, relationship-quotes, romance, romantic, thoughts, waves

quote: His head .. it exploded. As if someone had scooped out his brains and put a hand grenade in his skull.
author: Stephen King, I Am the Doorway

quote: For some reason Miss Jenner had seen fit to come uninvited to Sebastian’s home at a scandalously late hour. To make the situation even more compromising, she was unaccompanied—and spending more than a half minute alone with Sebastian was sufficient to ruin any girl. He was debauched, amoral, and perversely proud of it. He excelled at his chosen occupation—that of degenerate seducer—and he had set a standard few rakes could aspire to.
author: Lisa Kleypas, Devil in Winter

quote: All that love, all that pain, all the stuff people feel – not just me and you, brother, but everyone, everyone who's ever walked this beautiful green planet – how can all that disappear when somebody dies? It can't disappear, it's too big. Too strong, too... permanent. So it moves to another frequency, where the human ear can't pick up.
author: Jennifer Egan, The Keep

quote: This violent state of mind.This violent state of mine.
author: Don Winslow, Savages

quote: The more power one gives to his thought--the more completely he believes that his thought has power--the more power will it have.
author: Ernest Holmes, The Science of Mind

quote: If only a man can work on that thought within 48 hours the reality will manifest
author: Adedayo Olabamiji

quote: I wish I could close my eyes and be blown into dust and nothingness, feel all my thoughts disperse like dandelion fluff drifting off on the wind.
author: Lauren Oliver, Delirium
category: blown, dandelion, delirium-trilogy, disperse, lena-haloway, nothingness, thoughts

quote: Thoughts made our future, Choose your thoughts wisely.
author: Sourav Adhikari

quote: If I was alone I'd find something to do. Read or work on homework or doodle, fake it, so if I was alone it'd look like I wanted to be alone.
author: Julie Anne Peters, grl2grl

quote: Horrors of a nature most stern and most appalling would too frequently obtrude themselves upon my mind, and shake the innermost depths of my soul with the bare supposition of their possibility.
author: Edgar Allan Poe, The Unparalleled Adventure of One Hans Pfaall

quote: There are three levels of consciousness. The first level is when you stop thinking and letting outside sources think for you. In which you become a different mind. The second is simply thinking. The third the highest form of consciousness. Is when you rise ABOVE thought. Transcend thought by shutting it completely off.
author: Matthew Donnelly

quote: It's not happening to you, it's happening through you. Check your thoughts and your energetic output for the answers.
author: Sanjo Jendayi
category: energetic, energy, happening, sanjo-jendayi, self-actualization, situations, thoughts, through

quote: There is madness in the every heart.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Be willing to sacrifice everything. Detach from everything to be willing to become more than you THINK that you are. To live differently.
author: Matthew Donnelly

quote: You're the only man I know willing to jump from the top floor of a skyscraper, naked with an axe just to get the bad guy - Selena
author: David Gallie, Voodoo Queen

quote: I wasn't ready for goodbye, not now, not yet. Stay with me tonight, please don't go just yet.
author: Anya

quote: Renewal of mind, revival of spirit.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: My Life is My MOM & DAD
